criteria.title: Product Vision and Strategy
criteria.description: The clarity, alignment, and adaptability of the product's long-term goals and how they support the overall business objectives.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product vision is unclear or inconsistently communicated. No formal strategy for aligning product goals with business objectives.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Product vision is somewhat defined, with efforts made to align it with business objectives. Strategy is documented but lacks periodic updates.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Product vision is clearly articulated, fully aligned with business objectives, and regularly reviewed. All stakeholders understand the strategy and direction.

criteria.title: Clear Product Vision and Roadmap
criteria.description: Well-defined long-term goals and purpose of the product. A documented roadmap outlining future developments.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product goals are loosely defined, and there is no formal roadmap. Future developments are addressed on an as-needed basis.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Product goals are defined and communicated, with a roadmap that covers the next 6-12 months. The roadmap is reviewed occasionally.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Product goals are clearly defined, with a detailed roadmap extending beyond 12 months. The roadmap is actively maintained and adjusted based on changes in business or market conditions.

criteria.title: Strategic Alignment
criteria.description: Alignment of the product strategy with business goals and objectives. Regular review and updating of the product strategy to reflect market changes.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product strategy is not aligned with broader business objectives. No structured process to ensure alignment.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Product strategy is somewhat aligned with business goals, but reviews and updates are infrequent or reactive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Product strategy is fully aligned with business goals and regularly reviewed to ensure relevance. Stakeholders are involved in the alignment process, and updates are proactive based on market and business insights.

criteria.title: Innovation Roadmap
criteria.description: Plans for incorporating innovation to stay ahead of industry trends. Investment in research and development initiatives.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal plans for innovation or R&D investment. Innovation efforts are sporadic and unstructured.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: There is some planning for innovation, including occasional R&D investments. The organization explores emerging trends but lacks a dedicated innovation strategy.
maturity_definitions.advanced: A structured innovation roadmap is in place, backed by significant R&D investment. The organization actively scouts emerging trends and incorporates them into future product plans. Innovation is a strategic priority.

criteria.title: Long-Term Product Vision Communication
criteria.description: Effective communication of the product vision to all stakeholders. Processes to ensure that the team understands and is aligned with the vision.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product vision is communicated sporadically, resulting in a lack of shared understanding among stakeholders. There are no established processes for communication.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Product vision is communicated to key stakeholders, but alignment is inconsistent across the team. Communication occurs periodically but lacks formal reinforcement.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Product vision is communicated clearly and frequently across the organization. Processes are in place to ensure understanding and alignment, including regular updates, workshops, and team-wide discussions.

criteria.title: Market Understanding and Product-Market Fit
criteria.description: The organization's grasp of the market landscape and how well the product meets customer needs.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited understanding of market dynamics, relying on anecdotal information. Product-market fit is unproven or undefined.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic market analysis conducted with some metrics in place. Product-market fit is partially validated but not consistently measured.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive market research is conducted regularly. Product-market fit is well established, supported by strong retention, engagement, and satisfaction metrics.

criteria.title: Market Research and Understanding
criteria.description: Ongoing analysis of market trends, customer needs, and competitor offerings. Use of data to inform product decisions.

maturity_definitions.novice: Market research is ad-hoc or nonexistent, with limited awareness of trends and competitor actions.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Market research is conducted periodically, focusing on customer needs and competitor analysis. Insights are sometimes used in decision-making.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Continuous market research is conducted, including trend analysis and competitor monitoring. Insights are systematically used to drive product decisions.

criteria.title: Product-Market Fit Evidence
criteria.description: Clear value proposition addressing specific market needs. Metrics indicating customer retention, engagement, and satisfaction.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product-market fit is uncertain, with no structured way of measuring customer satisfaction or engagement.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: There are basic metrics in place for tracking product-market fit, such as customer satisfaction scores. The value proposition is somewhat defined.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Product-market fit is validated through multiple metrics like retention, Net Promoter Score (NPS), and consistent engagement. The value proposition is clearly defined and well-communicated.

criteria.title: Customer Segmentation
criteria.description: Detailed understanding of different customer groups and their unique needs. Tailored strategies for each segment.

maturity_definitions.novice: Customer segmentation is minimal, with limited differentiation between customer groups. Strategies are generic and not targeted.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some customer segments are identified, and basic tailoring is done for each group. The segmentation is updated occasionally.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive customer segmentation is performed with distinct strategies for each segment. Segments are regularly reviewed and refined based on new insights.

criteria.title: Feedback Integration
criteria.description: Mechanisms for collecting and incorporating customer feedback into product development. Regular updates based on user insights.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal mechanism for collecting or integrating customer feedback. Feedback is handled on an ad-hoc basis.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some processes are in place to collect feedback, with occasional updates made to the product. Feedback is used reactively rather than proactively.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Formal feedback collection processes are integrated throughout the product lifecycle. User insights are regularly reviewed and drive continuous product updates and improvements.

criteria.title: User Experience (UX) and Design
criteria.description: The emphasis on delivering a seamless and intuitive experience for the end-user.

maturity_definitions.novice: UX considerations are minimal, with inconsistent design practices. User experience is not prioritized during product development.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: UX is considered during development, with occasional usability tests. Design practices are somewhat consistent, but gaps still exist.
maturity_definitions.advanced: UX is a core part of the product strategy, with continuous usability testing and a focus on user feedback. Design is consistent and follows established best practices across all touchpoints.

criteria.title: User-Centered Design Practices
criteria.description: Implementation of user research, personas, and user journey mapping. Iterative design processes incorporating user feedback.

maturity_definitions.novice: User research is rarely conducted, and personas are either outdated or nonexistent. There is no structured design process.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some user research is conducted, and personas are created for key user groups. Design iterations incorporate some user feedback, but not consistently.
maturity_definitions.advanced: User-centered design is embedded in the product development process. Personas are well-developed, and user journeys are mapped out. Iterative design cycles are driven by continuous user feedback.

criteria.title: Accessibility Compliance
criteria.description: Adherence to accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG). Ensuring the product is usable by people with disabilities.

maturity_definitions.novice: Accessibility is not considered during product development. The product may not meet basic accessibility standards.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some efforts are made to adhere to accessibility guidelines, but compliance is inconsistent. Accessibility testing is infrequent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Accessibility is a priority, and the product fully complies with standards such as WCAG. Regular accessibility testing is conducted, and improvements are continuously made to ensure inclusivity.

criteria.title: Consistent UI/UX Standards
criteria.description: Maintenance of a consistent and intuitive user interface across platforms. Regular usability testing with real users.

maturity_definitions.novice: UI and UX are inconsistent across the product, with no defined standards. Usability testing is rarely conducted.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic UI/UX standards exist, but they are not consistently followed. Usability testing is conducted occasionally, with limited impact on design changes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: UI/UX standards are well-documented and consistently applied. Regular usability testing is conducted with real users, and insights lead to continuous improvements in user experience.

criteria.title: Mobile and Cross-Platform Consistency
criteria.description: Feature parity and consistent experience between web and mobile platforms. Optimization for device-specific features and interactions.

maturity_definitions.novice: The mobile experience is secondary, with limited feature parity. Web and mobile designs are inconsistent, leading to a disjointed user experience.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Efforts are made to ensure feature parity between web and mobile platforms. Design is somewhat consistent, but optimization for mobile is not comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Feature parity is fully maintained across all platforms. The user experience is seamless, with designs optimized for each device type. Mobile and web experiences are consistent and coherent.

criteria.title: Product Development Process
criteria.description: The methodologies and practices governing how the product is developed and maintained.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product development follows inconsistent or unstructured methodologies. Processes are largely reactive with little focus on standardization.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: A structured development process is in place, using recognized methodologies. Processes are documented and applied but not always consistent across teams.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Product development processes are well-optimized, following established methodologies. Continuous improvement is emphasized, with regular review and adaptation.

criteria.title: Agile Methodologies Adoption
criteria.description: Use of agile practices for iterative development and rapid release cycles. Flexibility to adapt to changing requirements.

maturity_definitions.novice: Agile practices are not followed or are poorly understood. Teams struggle with iterative development and adapting to changes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Agile practices are partially implemented, with regular sprints and iteration. Adaptation to changing requirements occurs, but inconsistencies remain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Agile methodologies are fully adopted, with continuous iterations, regular retrospectives, and rapid response to changing requirements. Teams are highly flexible and efficient.

criteria.title: Cross-Functional Collaboration
criteria.description: Effective collaboration between product, engineering, design, and other teams. Regular communication and joint planning sessions.

maturity_definitions.novice: Collaboration is limited, with silos existing between teams. Communication is sporadic and unstructured.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic collaboration exists between teams, supported by regular meetings and joint planning. Coordination between functions is improving but not fully consistent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Cross-functional collaboration is well-established, with frequent and effective communication across all teams. Joint planning sessions are a regular part of the development cycle, fostering a culture of shared ownership.

criteria.title: Documentation Standards
criteria.description: Maintenance of comprehensive product and process documentation. Accessibility of documentation for all team members.

maturity_definitions.novice: Documentation is sparse or outdated, making it difficult for team members to find relevant information. No formal standards exist.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic documentation standards are followed, with documentation being created for major features and processes. Accessibility is improving, but gaps remain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive documentation standards are in place, with all product and process details well-documented. Documentation is easily accessible, regularly reviewed, and updated.

criteria.title: Technical Debt Management
criteria.description: Identification and tracking of technical debt. Strategies for addressing and reducing debt while balancing new feature development.

maturity_definitions.novice: Technical debt is not formally tracked, and issues are addressed only when they cause major problems. There is no proactive management.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Technical debt is identified and tracked, but addressing it is inconsistent. There is some effort to balance debt reduction with new feature development.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Technical debt is systematically identified, tracked, and managed. Prioritization is based on impact, and there is a strategic balance between debt reduction and new feature development.

criteria.title: Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
criteria.description: Implementation of CI/CD pipelines for efficient and reliable releases. Automated testing and deployment processes.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal CI/CD process is in place. Releases are manual, error-prone, and infrequent.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic CI/CD practices are implemented, with some automated testing and deployment. Releases are more reliable but not yet fully automated.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive CI/CD pipelines are in place, supporting frequent and reliable releases. Automated testing and deployment are well-integrated into the development process, reducing manual intervention.

criteria.title: Product Architecture and Scalability
criteria.description: The design of the product's technical architecture to ensure performance, scalability, and maintainability.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product architecture is monolithic, with limited consideration for scalability or maintainability. Documentation is sparse.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Product architecture is modular but lacks scalability planning. Documentation is present but may not be comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Product architecture is designed for scalability, maintainability, and performance. Documentation is thorough, and architecture is reviewed and optimized regularly.

criteria.title: Well-Documented Architecture
criteria.description: Detailed documentation of the product's architecture. Clarity in system design and component interactions.

maturity_definitions.novice: Architecture documentation is incomplete or outdated, making it difficult for team members to understand system design.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic architecture documentation is available, covering key components and interactions. Some gaps may exist, but overall clarity is improving.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Architecture documentation is comprehensive and kept up-to-date, with detailed descriptions of all components and their interactions. It is readily accessible to all relevant team members.

criteria.title: Scalability Considerations
criteria.description: Infrastructure that supports growth and can handle increased user load. Performance optimization practices.

maturity_definitions.novice: Scalability is not considered in the product design, resulting in performance issues as user load increases.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some scalability measures are in place, such as load balancing or performance tuning, but they are not comprehensive. Scalability is reactive rather than proactive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Scalability is a core design principle, with infrastructure capable of handling significant growth. Performance is actively monitored, and optimizations are continuously implemented.

criteria.title: Modularity and Extensibility
criteria.description: Design allowing easy addition or replacement of components. Use of microservices or modular approaches where appropriate.

maturity_definitions.novice: The product architecture is tightly coupled, making changes difficult and prone to causing unintended issues.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some modular design principles are applied, allowing for component replacement or extension, but challenges remain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: The product is designed with modularity and extensibility in mind, often using microservices. Components can be easily replaced or extended, supporting rapid iteration and innovation.

criteria.title: API Strategy and Management
criteria.description: Provision of well-documented APIs for integration. API versioning and deprecation policies.

maturity_definitions.novice: APIs are inconsistently documented, making integration challenging. There are no formal policies for versioning or deprecation.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: APIs are documented, and some versioning practices are followed. Deprecation is handled on an ad-hoc basis.
maturity_definitions.advanced: APIs are thoroughly documented, with clear versioning and deprecation policies. API management practices are standardized to ensure smooth integrations and minimal disruption during changes.

criteria.title: Cloud-Native and Serverless Architectures
criteria.description: Utilization of cloud-native services and serverless computing where beneficial. Strategies for optimizing resource usage and cost.

maturity_definitions.novice: No use of cloud-native or serverless technologies. Infrastructure is largely on-premises or inflexible.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some adoption of cloud-native services or serverless architecture, but usage is limited. Cost and resource optimization are not fully realized.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Extensive use of cloud-native and serverless architectures, with a focus on scalability and cost optimization. Resource usage is closely monitored and optimized for efficiency.

criteria.title: Quality Assurance and Testing
criteria.description: The processes in place to ensure the product meets quality standards before release.

maturity_definitions.novice: Quality assurance processes are informal or inconsistent. Testing is often reactive, conducted only after issues are identified.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Quality assurance processes are defined and applied with regular testing practices. Testing is more proactive but lacks full automation or comprehensive coverage.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Mature quality assurance processes are fully integrated into the development lifecycle, with automated testing and continuous quality monitoring in place.

criteria.title: Comprehensive Testing Strategy
criteria.description: Implementation of unit, integration, system, and acceptance testing. Automated testing coverage and continuous testing practices.

maturity_definitions.novice: Testing is limited to basic manual testing. There is little or no unit, integration, or automated testing in place.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some automated testing is implemented, with unit and integration testing practices being developed. System testing occurs but may not be comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: A robust testing strategy includes full automation across unit, integration, system, and acceptance testing, with continuous testing integrated into the CI/CD pipeline.

criteria.title: Performance and Load Testing
criteria.description: Regular performance benchmarking and load testing. Strategies for handling peak usage periods.

maturity_definitions.novice: Performance and load testing is sporadic or absent. There is no formal strategy for handling peak usage periods.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Performance and load testing is performed periodically, with some ability to handle peak loads. Testing covers typical use cases but may miss edge cases.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Performance and load testing is routinely performed with comprehensive strategies for peak usage periods. Results are actively used to optimize the product’s performance.

criteria.title: Defect Tracking and Resolution
criteria.description: Efficient processes for identifying, prioritizing, and fixing issues. Use of defect tracking tools and regular reporting.

maturity_definitions.novice: Defect tracking is informal or inconsistent. Issues may be recorded manually, with no structured process for prioritization or resolution.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Defect tracking tools are used consistently, with processes for prioritization and resolution. However, the reporting may not be fully automated or standardized.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Defect tracking and resolution are highly efficient, with automated tools for tracking, reporting, and prioritizing issues. Resolutions are tracked with comprehensive metrics and analysis.

criteria.title: Security Testing
criteria.description: Regular security audits and penetration testing. Prompt addressing of identified vulnerabilities.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security testing is infrequent or limited to basic measures. Vulnerabilities may go unaddressed for extended periods.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular security testing is conducted, with vulnerabilities being addressed in a timely manner. Penetration testing occurs but may not cover all critical areas.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Security is a priority with frequent, comprehensive audits and penetration testing. Vulnerabilities are addressed immediately, and security practices are continuously improved.

criteria.title: Release and Version Management
criteria.description: The management of product releases, including planning, deployment, and rollback procedures.

maturity_definitions.novice: Release management is ad hoc, with minimal planning. There are no formal rollback procedures, and deployments often result in unexpected issues.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Release management is planned, with defined cycles and rollback procedures. However, deployments may still rely on manual intervention and lack full automation.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Release management is fully automated and integrated with CI/CD pipelines. Rollback procedures are well-defined and tested regularly, ensuring minimal downtime.

criteria.title: Defined Release Cycles
criteria.description: Clear schedules and processes for releasing updates. Communication of release notes and changes to stakeholders.

maturity_definitions.novice: Release cycles are inconsistent or unpredictable. Communication with stakeholders is minimal or nonexistent.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Release cycles are defined but may experience occasional delays. Stakeholders are informed of changes, but release notes may lack detail.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Release cycles are strictly adhered to, with clear communication of changes and detailed release notes. Stakeholders are fully aware of upcoming releases.

criteria.title: Feature Flagging and Gradual Rollout
criteria.description: Use of feature flags to control the release of new features. Strategies for gradual rollout and rollback capabilities.

maturity_definitions.novice: Feature flagging is not used. New features are released all at once, and rollback procedures are manual and error-prone.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Feature flags are used for major releases, allowing for gradual rollout. Rollback capabilities are in place but not fully automated.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Feature flags are extensively used, enabling gradual rollout and rollback of features in real-time. Rollbacks are automated and seamlessly integrated into the deployment process.

criteria.title: Version Control and End-of-Life Policies
criteria.description: Effective management of product versions and updates. Policies for phasing out older versions and supporting legacy systems.

maturity_definitions.novice: Version control is informal, with no clear policy for managing versions or end-of-life. Legacy systems are often unsupported or poorly managed.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Version control is structured, with policies for managing updates and end-of-life. Legacy systems are supported but may lack clear timelines for deprecation.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Version control is meticulously managed with clear, enforced policies for version updates and end-of-life. Legacy systems have structured support and deprecation timelines.

criteria.title: Deployment Automation
criteria.description: Automated deployment processes to reduce manual errors. Use of infrastructure as code practices.

maturity_definitions.novice: Deployments are manual, prone to errors, and time-consuming. Automation is either absent or in the very early stages.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Partial deployment automation is in place, reducing some manual errors, but there are still manual steps involved. Infrastructure as code is being implemented.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Deployment processes are fully automated, with infrastructure as code practices in place. Deployments are reliable, fast, and repeatable.

criteria.title: Data-Driven Decision Making and Analytics
criteria.description: The use of data and analytics to inform product decisions and measure success.

maturity_definitions.novice: Data collection is minimal or inconsistent. Decisions are made based on intuition rather than data.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic analytics are implemented, with key metrics being tracked. However, data is not yet fully integrated into decision-making processes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Data is deeply integrated into the decision-making process, with advanced analytics and metrics tracking. Decisions are always data-driven.

criteria.title: Analytics Integration
criteria.description: Implementation of product usage analytics tools. Tracking of key performance indicators (KPIs).

maturity_definitions.novice: Analytics tools are either not in use or only track a limited set of metrics. KPIs are poorly defined or not tracked.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Analytics tools are implemented, and key KPIs are tracked regularly. However, the data may not be fully leveraged to drive decisions.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Analytics tools are fully integrated, with comprehensive KPI tracking. Data is actively used to inform decisions and improve product performance.

criteria.title: A/B Testing and Experimentation
criteria.description: Infrastructure for running experiments and validating hypotheses. Processes for analyzing results and integrating findings.

maturity_definitions.novice: A/B testing is infrequent or ad hoc, with no formal process for experimentation.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: A/B testing infrastructure is in place, but experimentation may be limited to certain teams or features. Results are inconsistently analyzed.
maturity_definitions.advanced: A robust experimentation culture is supported by a scalable A/B testing infrastructure. Experimentation is widespread, and findings are thoroughly analyzed and integrated.

criteria.title: User Behavior Analysis
criteria.description: In-depth analysis of how users interact with the product. Use of insights to improve user experience and engagement.

maturity_definitions.novice: User behavior is only understood at a basic level, with little effort made to analyze or improve user experience.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some user behavior data is analyzed, with insights occasionally used to influence product decisions. User experience improvements are ad hoc.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive user behavior analysis is regularly conducted, and insights are consistently used to drive product decisions and optimize user experience.

criteria.title: Self-Service Data Access
criteria.description: Provision of tools for team members to access and analyze data independently. Training on data literacy and interpretation.

maturity_definitions.novice: Data access is restricted, and team members rely on technical staff for data retrieval. Little to no training on data interpretation is provided.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Self-service data tools are available to some team members, but access may be limited or require approval. Training on data literacy is basic.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Self-service data tools are widely available across teams, with full training provided on data interpretation and analysis. Data literacy is a core part of the culture.

criteria.title: Customer Feedback and Support
criteria.description: The mechanisms for supporting customers and integrating their feedback into the product lifecycle.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited customer support channels. Feedback collection is sporadic and informal. No structured process for integrating customer insights into product development.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Multiple support channels available. Regular feedback collection, but analysis is inconsistent. Some attempts to incorporate customer insights into product decisions.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, multi-channel support system with rapid response times. Systematic feedback collection and analysis. Customer insights directly influence product strategy and development.

criteria.title: Multiple Support Channels
criteria.description: Availability of various support avenues (chat, email, phone). Quick response times and resolution processes.

maturity_definitions.novice: Single support channel, typically email. Slow response times and no defined resolution process.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Two or three support channels available. Moderate response times with basic resolution tracking.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Multiple support channels including chat, email, phone, and social media. Quick response times and efficient resolution processes with clear SLAs.

criteria.title: Feedback Collection Mechanisms
criteria.description: Tools for collecting customer feedback (surveys, in-app prompts). Processes for analyzing and acting on feedback.

maturity_definitions.novice: Ad-hoc feedback collection, usually through direct communication. No formal analysis or action plan.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular surveys and some in-app feedback tools. Basic analysis of feedback, but inconsistent follow-through.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Multiple feedback collection methods including surveys, in-app prompts, and user behavior analysis. Systematic analysis and clear processes for acting on insights.

criteria.title: Customer Success Programs
criteria.description: Proactive initiatives to ensure customer satisfaction and retention. Regular check-ins and value delivery assessments.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal customer success program. Reactive approach to customer issues.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic customer success program with occasional check-ins. Some proactive measures, but mostly focused on problem-solving.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive customer success program with regular check-ins, value delivery assessments, and proactive strategies to drive customer satisfaction and retention.

criteria.title: Integration with Product Development
criteria.description: Feedback loops between support teams and product teams. Use of customer insights to inform the product roadmap.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited communication between support and product teams. Customer insights rarely influence product decisions.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some feedback loops established. Customer insights occasionally inform product roadmap, but process is not formalized.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Strong, formalized feedback loops between support and product teams. Customer insights regularly and systematically inform product roadmap and development priorities.

criteria.title: Compliance and Regulatory Alignment
criteria.description: The adherence to legal, industry, and ethical standards relevant to the product.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal awareness of relevant regulations. Compliance efforts are reactive and ad-hoc.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic understanding of key regulations. Some proactive compliance measures in place, but gaps remain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive understanding and proactive adherence to all relevant regulations. Regular audits and updates to ensure ongoing compliance.

criteria.title: Data Protection and Privacy Compliance
criteria.description: Compliance with data privacy laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA). Implementation of privacy by design principles.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of data protection laws. No formal privacy policies or processes in place.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic compliance with major data protection laws. Some privacy by design principles implemented, but not consistently.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Full compliance with all relevant data protection laws. Privacy by design principles fully integrated into all aspects of product development and operations.

criteria.title: Industry-Specific Regulations
criteria.description: Adherence to regulations specific to the industry (e.g., HIPAA for healthcare, financial regulations). Regular compliance audits and updates.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited knowledge of industry-specific regulations. No formal compliance processes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Awareness of key industry regulations. Some compliance measures in place, but audits are infrequent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive understanding and adherence to all industry-specific regulations. Regular compliance audits and proactive updates to meet changing requirements.

criteria.title: Security Standards Implementation
criteria.description: Following best practices for security to protect against vulnerabilities. Maintenance of audit trails and logs for compliance purposes.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic security measures in place. Limited or no audit trails maintained.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Standard security practices implemented. Audit trails and logs maintained, but not consistently reviewed.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Advanced security measures aligned with industry best practices. Comprehensive audit trails and logs maintained and regularly reviewed for compliance and security insights.

criteria.title: Accessibility and Ethical Standards
criteria.description: Commitment to ethical practices in product development. Ensuring product accessibility and inclusivity.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited consideration of accessibility or ethical standards in product development.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic accessibility features implemented. Some ethical considerations in place, but not formalized.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive accessibility features ensuring inclusivity for all users. Formal ethical guidelines integrated into all aspects of product development and decision-making.

criteria.title: Security and Data Protection
criteria.description: The measures taken to secure the product and protect user data.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic security measures in place. Limited understanding of potential threats and vulnerabilities.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Standard security practices implemented. Some proactive measures, but gaps in comprehensive protection remain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust, multi-layered security measures in place. Proactive threat detection and mitigation. Continuous monitoring and improvement of security practices.

criteria.title: Security Considerations in Design
criteria.description: Incorporation of security principles from the outset. Regular threat modeling and risk assessments.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security is an afterthought in design. No formal threat modeling or risk assessment processes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security principles considered in design. Occasional threat modeling and risk assessments conducted.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Security-first approach in all design decisions. Regular, comprehensive threat modeling and risk assessments integrated into the development lifecycle.

criteria.title: Regular Security Audits
criteria.description: Conducting internal and external security reviews. Prompt remediation of identified issues.

maturity_definitions.novice: Infrequent or reactive security reviews. Slow response to identified issues.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular internal security reviews. External audits conducted occasionally. Moderate speed in addressing identified issues.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Frequent internal and external security audits. Rapid and thorough remediation of all identified issues. Continuous monitoring and improvement of security posture.

criteria.title: Data Encryption and Protection
criteria.description: Use of encryption for data at rest and in transit. Secure data storage practices.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic encryption for some data. Inconsistent data storage practices.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Standard encryption for most data at rest and in transit. Generally secure data storage practices, but some vulnerabilities may exist.
maturity_definitions.advanced: State-of-the-art encryption for all data at rest and in transit. Robust, secure data storage practices with regular reviews and updates.

criteria.title: Incident Response Plan
criteria.description: Established procedures for responding to security incidents. Communication plans for stakeholders in case of breaches.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal incident response plan. Ad-hoc responses to security incidents.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic incident response plan in place. Some team members trained in response procedures. Limited stakeholder communication plan.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, regularly updated incident response plan. All team members trained and roles clearly defined. Detailed stakeholder communication plan with regular drills and simulations.

criteria.title: Integration and Interoperability
criteria.description: The product's ability to integrate with other systems and support interoperability.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited integration capabilities. Interoperability is not a primary consideration in product design.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic integration options available. Some consideration for interoperability, but not consistently implemented.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust integration capabilities with a wide range of systems. Interoperability is a key design principle, with support for multiple standards and protocols.

criteria.title: API Availability and Quality
criteria.description: Provision of robust and well-documented APIs. Support for integration with third-party systems.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or poorly documented APIs. Minimal support for third-party integrations.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic APIs available with adequate documentation. Some support for common third-party integrations.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, well-documented APIs with versioning. Extensive support for third-party integrations, including developer resources and sandbox environments.

criteria.title: Standards Compliance
criteria.description: Adherence to industry standards for data formats and protocols. Support for open standards to facilitate interoperability.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of industry standards. Proprietary formats and protocols are primarily used.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Partial compliance with major industry standards. Some support for open standards, but not consistently implemented.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Full compliance with relevant industry standards. Strong support for open standards, actively contributing to standard development in the industry.

criteria.title: Modular and Extensible Design
criteria.description: Architecture that allows for easy addition or replacement of components. Support for plugins or extensions.

maturity_definitions.novice: Monolithic architecture with limited modularity. No support for plugins or extensions.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some modularity in design. Basic support for plugins or extensions, but with limited capabilities.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Highly modular and extensible architecture. Robust plugin ecosystem with well-documented extension points and developer tools.

criteria.title: Third-Party Integration Strategy
criteria.description: Clear strategy for selecting and integrating third-party components. Management of dependencies and regular audits.

maturity_definitions.novice: Ad-hoc approach to third-party integrations. No formal strategy or dependency management.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic strategy for third-party integrations. Some dependency management, but audits are infrequent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive strategy for third-party integrations. Rigorous dependency management with regular audits and updates.

criteria.title: Localization and Internationalization
criteria.description: The product's capability to serve users in different geographic regions and cultures.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no localization. Product primarily serves a single geographic region or culture.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic localization for major markets. Some consideration for cultural differences, but gaps remain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive localization and internationalization. Product fully adapted for multiple regions and cultures, with ongoing efforts to expand global reach.

criteria.title: Multi-Language Support
criteria.description: Availability of the product in multiple languages. Support for language-specific nuances and scripts.

maturity_definitions.novice: Single language support. No consideration for language-specific nuances.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Support for a few major languages. Basic handling of language-specific nuances and scripts.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Extensive multi-language support with professional translations. Full support for language-specific nuances, scripts, and dialects.

criteria.title: Cultural Adaptation
criteria.description: Customization to meet local cultural norms and expectations. Consideration of regional usability preferences.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of cultural differences. One-size-fits-all approach to design and functionality.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic cultural adaptations for major markets. Some consideration of regional preferences, but not consistently applied.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive cultural adaptation across all supported regions. Regular user research to understand and incorporate regional usability preferences.

criteria.title: Local Regulations Compliance
criteria.description: Adherence to laws and regulations in different geographic regions. Data locality considerations and compliance.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of local regulations. No specific measures for data locality or regional compliance.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic compliance with major regional regulations. Some consideration for data locality, but gaps may exist.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Full compliance with all relevant local regulations. Robust data locality measures and proactive monitoring of regulatory changes across regions.

criteria.title: Currency and Date Format Support
criteria.description: Handling of different currencies, number formats, and date formats. Support for international payment systems.

maturity_definitions.novice: Single currency and date format support. Limited or no international payment options.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Support for major currencies and date formats. Basic integration with some international payment systems.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive support for multiple currencies, number formats, and date formats. Seamless integration with a wide range of international payment systems.

criteria.title: Pricing and Revenue Models
criteria.description: The strategies for monetizing the product and providing value to customers.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic, inflexible pricing model. Limited consideration of customer value or market dynamics.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Multiple pricing options available. Some alignment with customer value, but revenue strategies may lack sophistication.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Sophisticated, value-based pricing strategies. Multiple revenue streams with ongoing optimization based on market analysis and customer feedback.

criteria.title: Transparent Pricing Structures
criteria.description: Clear and straightforward pricing models. Communication of costs and fees to customers.

maturity_definitions.novice: Unclear or complex pricing structures. Limited communication of costs and fees.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Generally clear pricing models. Basic communication of costs and fees, but some ambiguities may exist.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Highly transparent and easy-to-understand pricing structures. Proactive and comprehensive communication of all costs and fees to customers.

criteria.title: Flexible Pricing Options
criteria.description: Offering different pricing models (subscription, freemium, one-time purchase). Ability to cater to different customer segments.

maturity_definitions.novice: Single, rigid pricing model. Limited ability to cater to different customer segments.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: A few pricing options available. Some ability to cater to major customer segments, but gaps remain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Wide range of flexible pricing options. Ability to effectively cater to multiple customer segments with tailored offerings.

criteria.title: Value-Based Pricing Strategies
criteria.description: Aligning pricing with the value delivered to customers. Regular assessment of pricing effectiveness.

maturity_definitions.novice: Pricing not clearly aligned with customer value. Infrequent or no assessment of pricing effectiveness.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some attempts to align pricing with customer value. Occasional assessment of pricing effectiveness.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Pricing strategies closely aligned with customer value. Regular, data-driven assessments of pricing effectiveness with continuous optimization.

criteria.title: Revenue Diversification
criteria.description: Multiple streams of revenue to mitigate risk. Exploration of new monetization opportunities.

maturity_definitions.novice: Single revenue stream. No active exploration of new monetization opportunities.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: A few revenue streams. Some exploration of new monetization opportunities, but implementation may be limited.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Multiple, diverse revenue streams. Continuous exploration and implementation of new monetization opportunities based on market trends and customer needs.

criteria.title: Ecosystem Development and Partnerships
criteria.description: Building an ecosystem around the product through partnerships and integrations.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no partnerships. Product operates in isolation with minimal integration capabilities.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some partnerships established. Basic integration support available, but ecosystem is still developing.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust partner network with seamless integrations. Thriving ecosystem that adds significant value to the product.

criteria.title: Third-Party Integrations
criteria.description: Support for integration with other products and services. Development of a partner network.

maturity_definitions.novice: Few or no third-party integrations. No formal partner network or integration program.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Several key integrations available. Emerging partner network with some standardized processes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Extensive integration options. Well-established partner network with clear benefits and support structures.

criteria.title: Developer Platforms and Tools
criteria.description: Provision of APIs, SDKs, and documentation for third-party developers. Support for community contributions and extensions.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no APIs available. Minimal documentation for external developers.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic APIs and SDKs provided. Documentation available but may have gaps. Some community contributions accepted.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive API ecosystem with well-maintained SDKs. Extensive documentation and active support for community-driven development.

criteria.title: Strategic Alliances
criteria.description: Building alliances with other companies to enhance product value. Participation in industry groups and standards bodies.

maturity_definitions.novice: No strategic alliances. Limited industry participation.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some alliances formed, primarily tactical. Occasional participation in industry groups.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Strong strategic alliances that significantly enhance product value. Active leadership in industry groups and standards development.

criteria.title: Marketplace or Plugin Ecosystem
criteria.description: Development of a marketplace for extensions, themes, or plugins. Encouraging third-party innovation on the platform.

maturity_definitions.novice: No marketplace or plugin system. Limited extensibility options.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic marketplace or plugin system available. Some third-party offerings, but ecosystem is still growing.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Thriving marketplace with diverse, high-quality offerings. Strong incentives and support for third-party developers.

criteria.title: Risk Management
criteria.description: The identification, assessment, and mitigation of risks related to the product.

maturity_definitions.novice: Reactive approach to risks. No formal risk management processes in place.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic risk management processes established. Some proactive risk identification, but mitigation may be inconsistent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive risk management framework. Proactive identification, assessment, and mitigation of risks across all aspects of the product.

criteria.title: Risk Identification Processes
criteria.description: Proactive identification of potential product risks. Regular risk assessments and reviews.

maturity_definitions.novice: Ad-hoc risk identification. No regular risk assessments.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Semi-regular risk assessments conducted. Some processes for identifying risks, but may not be comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Continuous risk identification processes. Regular, thorough risk assessments involving all relevant stakeholders.

criteria.title: Contingency Planning
criteria.description: Development of plans to address identified risks. Business continuity planning and disaster recovery strategies.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no contingency plans. Reactive approach to issues as they arise.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic contingency plans in place for major risks. Some disaster recovery measures, but may not be comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Detailed contingency plans for all significant risks. Robust business continuity and disaster recovery strategies regularly tested and updated.

criteria.title: Regulatory Changes Monitoring
criteria.description: Keeping abreast of regulatory changes that could impact the product. Agile response to new compliance requirements.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of regulatory environment. Slow to respond to changes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some monitoring of regulatory changes. Efforts made to comply, but may struggle with rapid changes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Proactive monitoring and analysis of regulatory landscape. Agile processes to quickly adapt to and implement new compliance requirements.

criteria.title: Operational Risk Management
criteria.description: Monitoring and mitigating risks in day-to-day operations. Incident management and learning from past issues.

maturity_definitions.novice: Reactive approach to operational issues. Limited learning from past incidents.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic operational risk monitoring in place. Some incident management processes, with efforts to learn from past issues.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive operational risk management. Sophisticated incident management and continuous improvement based on lessons learned.

criteria.title: Innovation and R&D
criteria.description: The commitment to innovation and incorporation of emerging technologies.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited focus on innovation. Minimal R&D efforts.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some investment in innovation and R&D. Occasional exploration of new technologies.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Strong culture of innovation with significant R&D investment. Continuous exploration and integration of cutting-edge technologies.

criteria.title: Investment in Research and Development
criteria.description: Allocation of resources for exploring new ideas and technologies. Encouragement of experimentation and innovation within teams.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal R&D budget. Little encouragement for team experimentation.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Moderate R&D investment. Some support for team innovation, but may lack structure.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Substantial R&D budget. Structured programs to encourage and support team experimentation and innovation.

criteria.title: Emerging Technologies Exploration
criteria.description: Keeping up with advancements in technology that could enhance the product. Pilot projects and prototypes to test new concepts.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of emerging technologies. Few or no pilot projects.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some exploration of emerging technologies. Occasional pilot projects, but may lack follow-through.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Systematic exploration of emerging technologies. Regular pilot projects and prototypes with clear pathways to implementation.

criteria.title: Intellectual Property Management
criteria.description: Protection of innovations through patents, trademarks, and copyrights. Awareness of IP considerations in product development.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited attention to IP protection. Minimal awareness of IP considerations in development.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic IP protection measures in place. Growing awareness of IP considerations in product development.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive IP strategy. Full integration of IP considerations in product development process.

criteria.title: AI and Machine Learning Integration
criteria.description: Use of AI/ML to enhance product features and capabilities. Strategies for model development, deployment, and maintenance.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no use of AI/ML in the product. No clear strategy for AI integration.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some AI/ML features implemented. Basic strategies for model development and deployment.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Extensive use of AI/ML throughout the product. Sophisticated strategies for model development, deployment, and continuous improvement.

criteria.title: User Engagement and Retention
criteria.description: The strategies employed to engage users and encourage ongoing product use.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited focus on user engagement. No clear retention strategies.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some engagement initiatives in place. Basic retention strategies implemented.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive user engagement and retention strategies. Continuous optimization based on user behavior and feedback.

criteria.title: User Engagement Metrics Tracking
criteria.description: Definition and monitoring of engagement metrics (e.g., active users, session duration). Regular analysis to inform engagement strategies.

maturity_definitions.novice: Few or no engagement metrics tracked. Limited analysis of user behavior.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic engagement metrics defined and monitored. Some analysis to inform strategies.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive set of engagement metrics tracked. Regular, in-depth analysis driving continuous improvement of engagement strategies.

criteria.title: Lifecycle Marketing Initiatives
criteria.description: Personalized communication strategies based on user behavior. Re-engagement campaigns for inactive users.

maturity_definitions.novice: Generic, one-size-fits-all marketing. No specific re-engagement efforts.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some personalization in marketing. Basic re-engagement campaigns for inactive users.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Highly personalized, behavior-driven marketing throughout the user lifecycle. Sophisticated re-engagement strategies with high success rates.

criteria.title: Onboarding Experience
criteria.description: Effective user onboarding flows that facilitate adoption. Personalization of onboarding based on user needs.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic or non-existent onboarding process. No personalization.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Structured onboarding flow. Some attempts at personalization based on user type.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Highly effective, personalized onboarding experiences. Continuous optimization based on user feedback and behavior analysis.

criteria.title: Community Building
criteria.description: Development of user communities or forums. Encouraging user-generated content and peer support.

maturity_definitions.novice: No community features or initiatives. Limited user-to-user interaction.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic community features available. Some encouragement of user-generated content and peer support.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Thriving user communities with high engagement. Active promotion and support of user-generated content and peer-to-peer assistance.

criteria.title: Customization and Extensibility
criteria.description: The ability for users or clients to customize the product to fit their specific needs.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no customization options available. Product is mostly one-size-fits-all with minimal flexibility.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some basic customization options are available, but may require technical expertise. Limited extensibility for specific use cases.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive customization options easily accessible to users. Robust extensibility framework allowing for deep integration and tailoring to specific needs.

criteria.title: User-Facing Customization Options
criteria.description: Features allowing users to tailor the product experience. Support for themes, layouts, or custom configurations.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal user-facing customization. Fixed layouts and themes with little to no configuration options.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic theming and layout options available. Some configurable elements, but limited in scope.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Extensive user-facing customization options. Fully customizable themes, layouts, and configurations with intuitive interfaces.

criteria.title: Backend Customization Capabilities
criteria.description: Flexibility in configuring backend processes or integrations. Support for custom workflows or data models.

maturity_definitions.novice: Rigid backend structure with no customization options. Fixed workflows and data models.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some backend customization possible, but requires developer intervention. Limited support for custom workflows.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Highly flexible backend with extensive APIs. Support for custom workflows, data models, and integrations without core code modifications.

criteria.title: Balance Between Customization and Maintainability
criteria.description: Strategies to prevent customization from hindering product updates. Documentation and management of custom configurations.

maturity_definitions.novice: Customizations often break during updates. Poor documentation of custom configurations.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic strategies to maintain customizations during updates. Some documentation of custom configurations, but not consistently maintained.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust framework ensuring customizations survive updates. Comprehensive documentation and version control for all custom configurations.

criteria.title: White-Label and Branding Options
criteria.description: Ability for clients to apply their own branding to the product. Support for white-label solutions where applicable.

maturity_definitions.novice: No white-label options. Product branding is fixed and cannot be altered.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic white-label options available, such as logo replacement. Limited ability to fully rebrand the product.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive white-label solution with full rebranding capabilities. Easy-to-use tools for clients to apply their own branding throughout the product.

criteria.title: Product Documentation and Knowledge Management
criteria.description: The creation and maintenance of documentation and knowledge resources for the product.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal documentation available. Knowledge management is ad-hoc and inconsistent.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic documentation in place. Some knowledge management processes, but not comprehensive or consistently maintained.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, well-organized documentation. Robust knowledge management system with regular updates and easy access for all stakeholders.

criteria.title: Comprehensive User Documentation
criteria.description: Detailed guides, FAQs, and help resources for users. Regular updates to reflect product changes.

maturity_definitions.novice: Sparse or outdated user documentation. FAQs and help resources are limited or non-existent.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic user guides and FAQs available. Documentation is updated occasionally, but may lag behind product changes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Extensive, up-to-date user documentation. Regularly maintained FAQs and help resources that accurately reflect the current product state.

criteria.title: Internal Knowledge Bases
criteria.description: Documentation for internal teams, including development and support. Version control and accessibility of internal resources.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal internal knowledge base. Information is scattered or undocumented.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic internal documentation exists but may be incomplete. Limited version control and inconsistent accessibility.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive internal knowledge base with robust version control. Easily accessible and searchable for all relevant internal teams.

criteria.title: Training and Onboarding Materials
criteria.description: Provision of materials to assist in user or client onboarding. Multimedia resources (videos, webinars) for varied learning preferences.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal onboarding materials. Training is mostly ad-hoc or verbal.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic written onboarding materials available. Some multimedia resources, but not comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Extensive, multi-format training and onboarding materials. Regularly updated multimedia resources catering to various learning styles.

criteria.title: Documentation Strategy and Maintenance
criteria.description: Processes for keeping documentation current. Assigning ownership and responsibility for documentation updates.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal documentation strategy. Updates are sporadic and reactive.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic documentation maintenance process in place. Some assigned responsibilities, but may lack consistency.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive documentation strategy with clear ownership. Regular review cycles and proactive updates aligned with product changes.

criteria.title: Product Lifecycle Management
criteria.description: The oversight of the product's journey from inception to retirement.

maturity_definitions.novice: Ad-hoc product lifecycle management. No clear strategy for different stages of the product lifecycle.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic lifecycle management processes in place. Some planning for different stages, but may lack comprehensive strategy.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive product lifecycle management strategy. Clear processes and planning for each stage from inception to retirement.

criteria.title: Version Management Strategy
criteria.description: Clear plans for releasing, updating, and sunsetting product versions. Strategies for managing multiple versions concurrently.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal version management strategy. Releases and updates are ad-hoc.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic version management process in place. Some planning for releases, but limited strategy for managing multiple versions.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive version management strategy. Well-defined processes for releasing, updating, and sunsetting versions with clear communication to stakeholders.

criteria.title: End-of-Life Policies
criteria.description: Defined policies for phasing out older versions. Communication plans for informing users of changes.

maturity_definitions.novice: No clear end-of-life policies. Users are often surprised by sudden discontinuation of support.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic end-of-life policies exist but may not be consistently applied. Some communication to users, but often with short notice.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Well-defined and consistently applied end-of-life policies. Clear, timely communication to users with ample notice and migration support.

criteria.title: Sustainability Practices
criteria.description: Consideration of environmental impacts in product development. Strategies for minimizing waste and promoting sustainability.

maturity_definitions.novice: Little to no consideration of sustainability in product development. No specific strategies for minimizing environmental impact.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some awareness of sustainability issues. Basic strategies in place to reduce environmental impact, but not comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Sustainability is a key consideration in all aspects of product development. Comprehensive strategies for minimizing waste and environmental impact throughout the product lifecycle.

criteria.title: Data Migration and Upgrade Tools
criteria.description: Tools to facilitate customer data migrations between versions. Minimizing downtime and data loss during upgrades.

maturity_definitions.novice: No dedicated data migration tools. Upgrades often result in significant downtime or data loss.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic data migration tools available. Some processes in place to minimize downtime, but may still experience issues.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust, automated data migration and upgrade tools. Seamless upgrades with minimal downtime and no data loss.

criteria.title: Cross-Functional Collaboration and Organizational Alignment
criteria.description: The degree to which the product function is integrated with other areas of the organization.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product function operates in isolation with minimal interaction with other departments. Collaboration is ad-hoc and reactive.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some cross-functional processes are in place, but integration is inconsistent. Occasional misalignments occur between departments.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Seamless integration of product function across the organization. Regular cross-functional collaboration is ingrained in the company culture.

criteria.title: Stakeholder Communication
criteria.description: Regular updates to stakeholders about product status and changes. Inclusion of stakeholder feedback in decision-making.

maturity_definitions.novice: Infrequent or inconsistent communication with stakeholders. Feedback is rarely sought or incorporated.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular updates are provided, but feedback loops are not fully closed. Some stakeholder input is considered in decision-making.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Proactive, transparent communication with all stakeholders. Feedback is systematically collected and integral to decision-making processes.

criteria.title: Alignment with Sales and Marketing
criteria.description: Coordination to ensure consistent messaging and support for product launches. Provision of necessary tools and information for sales teams.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited coordination between product, sales, and marketing teams. Inconsistent messaging and inadequate sales support.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some coordination efforts exist, but gaps remain in messaging alignment and sales enablement.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Seamless alignment between product, sales, and marketing. Comprehensive sales enablement tools and consistent messaging across all channels.

criteria.title: Leadership Support
criteria.description: Executive backing for product initiatives and strategies. Alignment of leadership goals with product direction.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited leadership involvement in product initiatives. Misalignment between executive goals and product direction.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some leadership support for product initiatives, but inconsistent alignment with overall business strategy.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Strong executive backing for product initiatives. Full alignment between leadership goals and product direction, with regular strategic reviews.

criteria.title: Collaborative Review Processes
criteria.description: Inclusion of multiple perspectives in product planning and review. Transparent and traceable decision-making processes.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no formal review processes. Decisions are made in silos with little input from diverse perspectives.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some collaborative review processes exist, but participation is inconsistent. Decision-making is partially transparent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust, inclusive review processes with diverse perspectives. Fully transparent and traceable decision-making, documented and accessible to all relevant parties.

criteria.title: Environmental and Social Responsibility
criteria.description: The organization's commitment to ethical practices and social impact through the product.

maturity_definitions.novice: Little to no consideration of environmental or social impact in product development. No formal ethical guidelines.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some awareness of ethical and social responsibilities, with occasional initiatives. Informal ethical considerations in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive ethical and social responsibility framework integrated into all aspects of product development and company operations.

criteria.title: Ethical Standards in Development
criteria.description: Adherence to ethical guidelines in product design and implementation. Consideration of the social impact of product features.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal ethical guidelines for product development. Limited awareness of potential social impacts.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic ethical guidelines exist, but application is inconsistent. Some consideration of social impact in feature development.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive ethical framework guides all product decisions. Rigorous assessment of social impact for all features, with regular ethical audits.

criteria.title: Sustainability Goals
criteria.description: Initiatives to minimize environmental impact. Use of sustainable resources and practices.

maturity_definitions.novice: No specific sustainability goals or initiatives. Limited awareness of environmental impact.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some sustainability initiatives in place, but not comprehensive. Basic tracking of environmental impact.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive sustainability strategy with clear goals and metrics. Proactive use of sustainable resources and practices throughout the product lifecycle.

criteria.title: Community Engagement
criteria.description: Participation in community programs or open-source projects. Support for social causes aligned with the organization's values.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal community engagement or support for social causes. No clear alignment with organizational values.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Occasional participation in community programs or open-source projects. Some support for social causes, but not strategically aligned.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Active, strategic engagement in community and open-source initiatives. Strong support for social causes that are fully aligned with organizational values and integrated into company culture.

criteria.title: Health and Well-being Considerations
criteria.description: Features that promote user well-being. Avoidance of practices that could harm users or society.

maturity_definitions.novice: Little consideration of user health and well-being in product design. No formal process to identify potentially harmful practices.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some features consider user well-being. Basic processes to avoid harmful practices, but not comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: User health and well-being are key drivers in product design. Rigorous processes to identify and mitigate potential harms, with regular impact assessments.

criteria.title: Product Performance Optimization
criteria.description: The continuous effort to improve product performance and efficiency.

maturity_definitions.novice: Reactive approach to performance issues. No systematic optimization efforts.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some proactive performance monitoring and optimization, but efforts are inconsistent or limited in scope.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Continuous, proactive performance optimization across all aspects of the product. Regular benchmarking and improvement initiatives.

criteria.title: Performance Benchmarking
criteria.description: Setting and measuring against key performance indicators (KPIs). Regular performance tuning and optimization efforts.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal KPIs or benchmarking process. Performance tuning is ad-hoc or reactive.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic KPIs established and occasionally measured. Some performance tuning efforts, but not systematic.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive set of KPIs with regular benchmarking. Continuous performance tuning and optimization based on data-driven insights.

criteria.title: Scalability Testing and Planning
criteria.description: Testing for scalability and planning for capacity increases. Strategies for handling large-scale data processing.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no scalability testing. Reactive approach to capacity planning.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some scalability testing performed, but not comprehensive. Basic capacity planning in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Rigorous scalability testing across various scenarios. Proactive capacity planning with strategies for efficient large-scale data processing.

criteria.title: Resource Management
criteria.description: Efficient use of resources to optimize costs. Monitoring and managing infrastructure usage.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal monitoring of resource usage. Inefficient resource allocation and cost management.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic monitoring of resource usage. Some efforts to optimize costs, but opportunities for improvement remain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive resource monitoring and management. Optimized resource allocation with continuous cost optimization strategies.

criteria.title: Application-Level Monitoring
criteria.description: Implementation of comprehensive monitoring beyond infrastructure. Quick diagnosis and resolution of application issues.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited monitoring focused primarily on infrastructure. Slow or reactive issue diagnosis and resolution.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some application-level monitoring in place. Improved issue diagnosis, but resolution times vary.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive application-level monitoring with advanced diagnostics. Rapid, often automated issue detection and resolution.

criteria.title: Product Portfolio Management
criteria.description: The management of multiple products or modules within an organization.

maturity_definitions.novice: Product portfolio is managed ad-hoc with no clear strategy. Products are developed and maintained in isolation with little coordination.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic portfolio management practices are in place. Some attempt at coordinating products, but lacks a comprehensive strategy.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Sophisticated portfolio management with clear strategies for each product. Resources are optimally allocated based on strategic importance and market demands.

criteria.title: Clear Product Portfolio Strategy
criteria.description: Defined strategies for each product or module. Resource allocation aligned with strategic importance.
