criteria.description: The establishment, enforcement, and continuous improvement of security policies and governance frameworks within the organization.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security policies are ad-hoc or non-existent. No formal governance structure is in place for security-related decisions.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security policies are documented and communicated. A governance framework exists but may lack comprehensive coverage or consistent enforcement.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive security policies are well-documented, regularly reviewed, and fully integrated into organizational processes. A robust governance framework is in place with clear accountability and continuous improvement mechanisms.

criteria.title: Documented Security Policies
criteria.description: Existence of comprehensive security policies covering all aspects of the organization. Regular review and updates of security policies. Communication and accessibility of policies to all employees.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security policies are minimal or outdated. No regular review process exists. Policies are not easily accessible to employees.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security policies are documented and cover major areas. Reviews occur sporadically. Policies are available to employees but may not be actively communicated.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, up-to-date security policies cover all aspects of the organization. Regular reviews and updates are scheduled. Policies are easily accessible and actively communicated to all employees.

criteria.title: Security Leadership
criteria.description: Designation of a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) or equivalent role. Clear reporting lines and authority for security leadership. Regular security updates to senior management and the board.

maturity_definitions.novice: No dedicated security leadership role. Security responsibilities are fragmented or undefined. Minimal reporting on security matters to senior management.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: A security leadership role exists but may lack full authority or resources. Basic reporting structures are in place. Occasional updates to senior management on security matters.
maturity_definitions.advanced: A CISO or equivalent role is established with clear authority and resources. Well-defined reporting lines exist. Regular, comprehensive security updates are provided to senior management and the board.

criteria.title: Regulatory Compliance
criteria.description: Identification of applicable regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, ISO 27001). Documented compliance strategies and controls. Regular compliance audits and assessments.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of applicable regulations. No formal compliance strategies in place. Compliance audits are reactive or non-existent.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Key regulations are identified. Basic compliance strategies exist but may not be comprehensive. Occasional compliance audits are conducted.
maturity_definitions.advanced: All applicable regulations are identified and tracked. Comprehensive compliance strategies and controls are documented and implemented. Regular, proactive compliance audits and assessments are conducted.

criteria.title: Security Awareness Training
criteria.description: Mandatory security training programs for all employees. Regular updates and refreshers on security best practices. Assessment of training effectiveness.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal security awareness training program. Ad-hoc or infrequent security communications to employees.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security awareness training is provided to employees. Some refresher courses are available. Limited assessment of training effectiveness.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, role-specific security awareness training is mandatory for all employees. Regular updates and refresher courses are provided. Training effectiveness is consistently assessed and the program is continuously improved.

criteria.title: Risk Management
criteria.description: The processes in place to identify, assess, mitigate, and monitor security risks throughout the organization.

maturity_definitions.novice: Risk management is reactive and ad-hoc. No formal risk assessment or mitigation processes are in place.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic risk management processes exist. Some risks are identified and assessed, but the approach may not be comprehensive or consistent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: A comprehensive risk management framework is implemented. Risks are systematically identified, assessed, mitigated, and monitored across the organization.

criteria.title: Risk Assessment Procedures
criteria.description: Regular identification and evaluation of security risks. Use of standardized risk assessment methodologies. Documentation of risk assessment findings.

maturity_definitions.novice: Risk assessments are infrequent or informal. No standardized methodology is used. Findings are poorly documented or not documented at all.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Risk assessments are conducted periodically. A basic methodology is used, but may not be consistently applied. Findings are documented but may lack detail.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Regular, comprehensive risk assessments using standardized methodologies. Findings are thoroughly documented and inform decision-making processes.

criteria.title: Risk Mitigation Strategies
criteria.description: Implementation of controls to address identified risks. Prioritization of risks based on impact and likelihood. Continuous monitoring of risk mitigation effectiveness.

maturity_definitions.novice: Risk mitigation is reactive and ad-hoc. No formal prioritization of risks. Limited or no monitoring of mitigation effectiveness.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic risk mitigation strategies are in place for major risks. Some prioritization occurs. Occasional monitoring of mitigation effectiveness.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive risk mitigation strategies are implemented. Risks are systematically prioritized based on impact and likelihood. Continuous monitoring and adjustment of mitigation strategies.

criteria.title: Incident Response Planning
criteria.description: Documented incident response plans for security breaches. Defined roles and responsibilities for incident handling. Regular testing and updating of incident response procedures.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal incident response plan. Roles and responsibilities are unclear. No regular testing or updates to response procedures.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic incident response plan exists. Some roles and responsibilities are defined. Occasional testing or updates to response procedures.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, well-documented incident response plan. Clearly defined roles and responsibilities. Regular testing, updating, and improvement of response procedures.

criteria.title: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery
criteria.description: Established plans to maintain operations during disruptions. Regular drills and updates to continuity plans. Defined Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO).

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal business continuity or disaster recovery plans. RTOs and RPOs are not defined. No regular drills or updates.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic continuity and recovery plans exist. RTOs and RPOs are defined for some critical systems. Occasional drills and updates to plans.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive business continuity and disaster recovery plans are in place. RTOs and RPOs are clearly defined for all systems. Regular drills and continuous improvement of plans.

criteria.title: Data Protection and Privacy
criteria.description: Measures taken to safeguard sensitive data and ensure user privacy throughout its lifecycle.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited data protection measures. No formal privacy policies or practices. Reactive approach to data security.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic data protection measures are in place. Some privacy policies exist but may not be comprehensive. Proactive measures are taken for critical data.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive data protection and privacy measures are implemented. Robust policies and practices cover all aspects of data lifecycle. Proactive and continuous improvement approach to data security and privacy.

criteria.title: Data Classification and Handling
criteria.description: Defined data classification scheme based on sensitivity and criticality. Data labeling and handling procedures. Employee training on data classification and handling.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal data classification scheme. Inconsistent or non-existent data handling procedures. Limited employee awareness of data handling responsibilities.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic data classification scheme exists. Some data handling procedures are defined. Periodic employee training on data handling.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive data classification scheme implemented. Detailed data handling procedures for all data types. Regular, role-specific employee training on data classification and handling.

criteria.title: Encryption Practices
criteria.description: Use of strong encryption for data at rest and in transit. Secure key management processes and practices. Regular audits of encryption implementation.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or inconsistent use of encryption. No formal key management processes. Infrequent or no audits of encryption practices.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Encryption used for some sensitive data. Basic key management processes in place. Occasional audits of encryption implementation.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Strong encryption consistently used for all sensitive data at rest and in transit. Robust key management processes and practices. Regular, comprehensive audits of encryption implementation.

criteria.title: Access Control
criteria.description: Implementation of the principle of least privilege. Regular reviews of user access rights and permissions. Secure methods for data sharing internally and externally.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic access controls with minimal enforcement of least privilege. Infrequent or no reviews of access rights. Ad-hoc methods for data sharing.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Access controls implement least privilege for some systems. Periodic reviews of user access rights. Some secure methods for data sharing are in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive access controls strictly enforce least privilege across all systems. Regular, automated reviews of user access rights and permissions. Secure, standardized methods for all internal and external data sharing.

criteria.title: Privacy Compliance
criteria.description: Adherence to data protection laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA). Processes for handling data subject requests. Privacy impact assessments for new projects.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of privacy laws. No formal processes for handling data subject requests. Privacy impact assessments are not conducted.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic compliance with key privacy laws. Some processes exist for handling data subject requests. Privacy impact assessments conducted for major projects.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Full compliance with all applicable privacy laws. Robust, efficient processes for handling all types of data subject requests. Privacy impact assessments are standard practice for all new projects and regularly reviewed.

criteria.title: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
criteria.description: Systems and policies that manage user identities and regulate access to resources.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic IAM practices are in place, but they are largely manual and inconsistent. Limited understanding of user access rights across the organization.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Centralized IAM system implemented with some automation. Regular access reviews conducted, but gaps in coverage or follow-up actions may exist.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Fully integrated IAM system with automated provisioning/de-provisioning. Comprehensive access reviews and audits conducted regularly with prompt remediation of issues.

criteria.title: Identity Management
criteria.description: Centralized identity management system. Automated user provisioning and de-provisioning processes. Regular user access reviews and audits.

maturity_definitions.novice: Decentralized identity management with manual provisioning processes. Infrequent or ad-hoc user access reviews.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Centralized identity management system in place. Semi-automated provisioning processes. Regular but not comprehensive user access reviews.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Fully centralized and automated identity management. Robust provisioning/de-provisioning workflows. Comprehensive and frequent user access audits with automated reporting.

criteria.title: Authentication Mechanisms
criteria.description: Implementation of strong authentication methods (e.g., MFA, SSO). Secure password policies aligned with industry best practices. Secure password storage using strong hashing algorithms.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic password policies in place. Limited or no use of multi-factor authentication. Passwords may be stored using weak hashing methods.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Multi-factor authentication available for critical systems. Password policies aligned with basic industry standards. Passwords stored using moderately strong hashing.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Multi-factor authentication enforced across all systems. SSO implemented. Robust password policies exceeding industry standards. Passwords stored using state-of-the-art hashing algorithms.

criteria.title: Access Control Models
criteria.description: Role-based access control (RBAC) or attribute-based access control (ABAC). Regular access rights reviews and adjustments. Enforcement of the principle of least privilege.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic access controls with limited role definitions. Infrequent access rights reviews. Limited application of least privilege principle.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: RBAC implemented for most systems. Semi-regular access rights reviews. Least privilege principle applied inconsistently.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Sophisticated RBAC or ABAC implemented across all systems. Frequent, automated access rights reviews and adjustments. Strict enforcement of least privilege principle.

criteria.title: Session Management
criteria.description: Secure handling of user sessions and tokens. Protection against session hijacking and fixation. Timeout policies for inactive sessions.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic session management with limited security measures. No or inconsistent timeout policies.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Secure session handling implemented. Basic protection against common session attacks. Timeout policies in place for most systems.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust session management with strong protection against all known session attacks. Consistent, risk-based timeout policies enforced across all systems.

criteria.title: Application and Infrastructure Security
criteria.description: The security measures integrated into the organization's applications and underlying infrastructure.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic security measures applied inconsistently. Limited integration of security in application development and infrastructure management.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Security measures implemented across most applications and infrastructure. Some integration of security in development processes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive security measures fully integrated into all applications and infrastructure. Security-by-design principles applied consistently throughout the organization.

criteria.title: Secure Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
criteria.description: Integration of security practices into each phase of the SDLC. Regular security training for developers. Use of secure coding guidelines and standards.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited security practices in SDLC. Occasional developer security training. No formal secure coding guidelines.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Security integrated into some SDLC phases. Regular security training for developers. Basic secure coding guidelines in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Security fully integrated into all SDLC phases. Comprehensive, role-specific security training program. Robust, regularly updated secure coding standards enforced.

criteria.title: Vulnerability Management
criteria.description: Regular vulnerability assessments and penetration testing. Timely patching and remediation of identified vulnerabilities. Use of automated vulnerability scanning tools.

maturity_definitions.novice: Ad-hoc vulnerability assessments. Inconsistent patching practices. Limited use of vulnerability scanning tools.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular vulnerability assessments and pen tests. Structured patching process. Automated vulnerability scanning for critical systems.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Continuous vulnerability assessments and pen testing. Automated, risk-based patching process. Comprehensive vulnerability scanning integrated with development and deployment pipelines.

criteria.title: Network Security Controls
criteria.description: Use of firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems. Network segmentation and secure configurations. Regular monitoring and analysis of security events.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic firewall implementation. Limited network segmentation. Minimal security event monitoring.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Firewalls and IDS/IPS in place. Basic network segmentation implemented. Regular monitoring of critical security events.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Next-gen firewalls and advanced IDS/IPS deployed. Comprehensive network segmentation. Continuous, AI-assisted monitoring and analysis of all security events.

criteria.title: Third-Party Component Management
criteria.description: Assessment of third-party software and dependencies for security risks. Policies for updating and patching third-party components. Secure software supply chain practices.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited visibility into third-party components. Ad-hoc updates and patches. Minimal software supply chain security practices.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular assessment of major third-party components. Structured update and patch policies. Basic software supply chain security measures in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive inventory and continuous assessment of all third-party components. Automated update and patch management. Robust software supply chain security practices integrated into procurement and development processes.

criteria.title: Monitoring, Incident Detection, and Response
criteria.description: The capabilities to monitor systems, detect security incidents, and respond appropriately.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic monitoring in place. Limited incident detection capabilities. Ad-hoc incident response processes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular monitoring of critical systems. Moderate incident detection capabilities. Documented incident response procedures.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, real-time monitoring across all systems. Advanced incident detection leveraging AI/ML. Well-tested, continuously improved incident response capabilities.

criteria.title: Continuous Monitoring
criteria.description: Real-time monitoring of systems and networks for suspicious activities. Use of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools. Regular tuning of monitoring systems to reduce false positives.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic logging and monitoring of key systems. No SIEM or limited use. Minimal tuning of monitoring systems.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Real-time monitoring of critical systems and networks. SIEM implemented for log aggregation and analysis. Periodic tuning of monitoring systems.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, real-time monitoring across all systems and networks. Advanced SIEM with AI/ML capabilities. Continuous, automated tuning of monitoring systems for optimal performance.

criteria.title: Alerting and Notification
criteria.description: Automated alerts for potential security incidents. Defined escalation procedures for critical events. 24/7 monitoring and response capabilities.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic alerting for obvious security incidents. Informal escalation procedures. Limited after-hours coverage.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Automated alerts for various security events. Documented escalation procedures for most scenarios. Extended hours monitoring and response.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Sophisticated, context-aware alerting system. Comprehensive, regularly tested escalation procedures. 24/7 monitoring and response with automated triage and escalation.

criteria.title: Incident Response Plan
criteria.description: Documented procedures for responding to security incidents. Regular testing and updating of the incident response plan. Post-incident analysis and lessons learned.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic incident response procedures documented. Infrequent or no testing of the plan. Limited post-incident analysis.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Comprehensive incident response plan in place. Annual testing and updates. Regular post-incident analysis with some lessons learned implementation.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Detailed, regularly updated incident response plan covering various scenarios. Frequent testing including simulations and tabletop exercises. Thorough post-incident analysis with systematic implementation of lessons learned.

criteria.title: Threat Intelligence Integration
criteria.description: Use of threat intelligence feeds to stay updated on emerging threats. Adaptation of security measures based on the threat landscape. Collaboration with industry groups for threat sharing.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited use of public threat intelligence feeds. Minimal adaptation to emerging threats. Little to no industry collaboration.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular consumption of multiple threat intelligence feeds. Periodic updates to security measures based on threat intelligence. Some participation in industry threat sharing groups.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Integration of diverse, high-quality threat intelligence feeds into security operations. Continuous, automated adaptation of security measures based on threat intelligence. Active participation and leadership in industry threat sharing initiatives.

criteria.title: Physical Security
criteria.description: Measures to protect the organization's physical assets and facilities from unauthorized access or damage.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic physical security measures are in place, such as locked doors. There is limited awareness of physical security risks and no formal policies.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Moderate physical security controls are implemented, including access cards and some surveillance. Policies exist but may not be consistently enforced.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive physical security measures are in place, including advanced access controls, surveillance, and regular risk assessments. Policies are well-documented, enforced, and regularly updated.

criteria.title: Facility Access Controls
criteria.description: Secure entry systems (e.g., key cards, biometric scanners). Visitor management procedures and escort policies. Regular review and update of physical access rights.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic key or card access systems are in place. Visitor procedures are informal or inconsistent. Access rights are rarely reviewed.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Electronic access control systems are implemented. Formal visitor management procedures exist. Access rights are reviewed periodically but not comprehensively.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Advanced access controls, including biometrics, are utilized. Strict visitor management and escort policies are enforced. Access rights are regularly reviewed, updated, and audited.

criteria.title: Environmental Controls
criteria.description: Protection against environmental threats (e.g., fire suppression, climate control). Redundant power and network connectivity. Regular maintenance of physical security systems.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic fire extinguishers and climate control are present. No redundancy in power or connectivity. Maintenance is reactive.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Fire suppression systems and climate control are in place. Some redundancy exists. Maintenance is scheduled but may not be comprehensive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Advanced environmental controls are implemented. Full redundancy in power and connectivity. Proactive maintenance and monitoring of all systems with regular testing.

criteria.title: Asset Management
criteria.description: Inventory of physical IT assets. Secure disposal procedures for old equipment. Asset tracking and monitoring systems.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic inventory of major assets exists. No formal disposal procedures. Limited or no asset tracking.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Detailed inventory of IT assets is maintained. Basic disposal procedures are in place. Some asset tracking is implemented.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, real-time inventory of all IT assets. Secure, documented disposal procedures are strictly followed. Advanced asset tracking and monitoring systems are in place.

criteria.title: Surveillance and Monitoring
criteria.description: Use of CCTV and security personnel. Regular review of surveillance footage. Integration of surveillance systems with incident response procedures.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited CCTV coverage. Security personnel may be present but with no formal procedures. Surveillance footage is rarely reviewed.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: CCTV covers most critical areas. Security personnel follow basic procedures. Surveillance footage is reviewed periodically.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive CCTV coverage with advanced analytics. Well-trained security personnel follow detailed procedures. Surveillance systems are fully integrated with incident response, with real-time monitoring and alerts.

criteria.title: Supplier and Third-Party Risk Management
criteria.description: Management of security risks associated with vendors, suppliers, and other third parties.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of third-party risks. No formal assessment process. Minimal security requirements for suppliers.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic vendor risk assessment process exists. Some security requirements are included in contracts. Periodic reviews of major suppliers.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive third-party risk management program. Strict security requirements and regular assessments of all suppliers. Continuous monitoring and improvement of third-party security posture.

criteria.title: Vendor Assessment Process
criteria.description: Documented vendor risk assessment methodology. Regular security assessments of critical vendors. Contractual security requirements for vendors.

maturity_definitions.novice: Ad-hoc vendor assessments with no standardized methodology. Security requirements are not consistently included in contracts.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Documented risk assessment process for major vendors. Basic security requirements are included in most contracts. Assessments are conducted periodically.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, risk-based vendor assessment methodology. Detailed security requirements in all contracts. Regular assessments of all vendors with continuous monitoring of critical ones.

criteria.title: Third-Party Access Management
criteria.description: Controlled and monitored access for third parties. Regular review and audit of third-party access rights. Secure methods for data sharing with third parties.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited controls on third-party access. Infrequent or no reviews of access rights. Ad-hoc data sharing methods.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic access controls for third parties. Annual review of access rights. Some secure data sharing methods in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Stringent access controls with multi-factor authentication for all third parties. Quarterly review and audit of access rights. Secure, encrypted data sharing methods with detailed logging and monitoring.

criteria.title: Supply Chain Security
criteria.description: Security measures for the software supply chain. Verification of the integrity of third-party components and libraries. Regular security audits of the supply chain.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of supply chain risks. No formal verification of third-party components. Infrequent or no supply chain audits.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic measures to secure the software supply chain. Some verification of critical third-party components. Periodic supply chain audits.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive supply chain security program. Rigorous verification of all third-party components and libraries. Regular, in-depth security audits of the entire supply chain with continuous monitoring.

criteria.title: Contractual Obligations
criteria.description: Inclusion of right-to-audit clauses and compliance verification. Clear penalties for non-compliance with security requirements. Regular updates of contracts to reflect changing security standards.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited security clauses in contracts. No right-to-audit or specific penalties for non-compliance. Contracts are rarely updated.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic right-to-audit clauses and some penalties for non-compliance included in major contracts. Contracts are updated periodically.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive security clauses, including strict right-to-audit and clear penalties, in all contracts. Regular compliance verification. Contracts are continuously reviewed and updated to reflect the latest security standards.

criteria.title: Compliance and Audit
criteria.description: Adherence to legal, regulatory, and internal standards, and regular auditing to ensure compliance.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of compliance requirements. Audits are infrequent and reactive. No formal compliance program.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic compliance program in place. Regular audits are conducted but may not cover all areas. Some processes for addressing audit findings.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive compliance program aligned with all relevant standards. Regular, thorough audits with clear processes for addressing and tracking findings. Proactive approach to regulatory changes.

criteria.title: Regulatory Compliance
criteria.description: Identification of applicable laws and regulations. Processes to ensure ongoing compliance. Regular updates to compliance strategies based on regulatory changes.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited understanding of applicable regulations. Compliance efforts are reactive. No formal process for tracking regulatory changes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Major applicable regulations are identified. Basic processes exist for maintaining compliance. Some effort to track and respond to regulatory changes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive understanding of all applicable regulations. Robust processes ensure ongoing compliance. Proactive monitoring and rapid adaptation to regulatory changes.

criteria.title: Internal Audits
criteria.description: Regular internal audits of security controls and practices. Remediation of audit findings and continuous improvement. Documentation and tracking of audit results.

maturity_definitions.novice: Infrequent or ad-hoc internal audits. Limited follow-up on audit findings. Minimal documentation of audit results.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular internal audits of major security controls. Basic process for addressing audit findings. Audit results are documented but tracking may be inconsistent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, risk-based internal audit program covering all security controls. Robust process for remediation and continuous improvement. Detailed documentation and tracking of all audit results with executive visibility.

criteria.title: External Audits and Certifications
criteria.description: Engagement with external auditors for independent assessments. Achievement and maintenance of relevant certifications. Public disclosure of certifications and compliance status.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or no engagement with external auditors. Few or no relevant certifications. No public disclosure of compliance status.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Periodic engagement with external auditors. Some relevant certifications achieved. Limited public disclosure of certifications.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Regular engagement with reputable external auditors. All relevant certifications achieved and maintained. Full public disclosure of certifications and compliance status, demonstrating commitment to transparency.

criteria.title: Policy Enforcement
criteria.description: Mechanisms to enforce compliance with security policies. Consequences for policy violations. Monitoring of policy adherence across the organization.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited mechanisms for policy enforcement. Consequences for violations are unclear or inconsistent. Minimal monitoring of policy adherence.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic enforcement mechanisms in place. Defined consequences for major policy violations. Some monitoring of policy adherence in critical areas.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust, automated policy enforcement mechanisms. Clear, consistently applied consequences for all policy violations. Comprehensive monitoring of policy adherence across the entire organization with regular reporting.

criteria.title: Security Culture and Awareness
criteria.description: The promotion of a security-conscious culture within the organization.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security awareness is minimal, with no formal program in place. Employees have limited understanding of security risks and best practices.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: A basic security awareness program exists, with occasional training sessions. Some employees understand security risks, but the culture is not consistently security-focused.
maturity_definitions.advanced: A comprehensive security awareness program is in place, with regular training and communication. Security is ingrained in the organizational culture, with employees actively participating in maintaining a secure environment.

criteria.title: Employee Engagement
criteria.description: Encouragement of reporting security concerns or incidents. Inclusion of security objectives in performance reviews. Recognition and rewards for good security practices.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal process for reporting security concerns. Security is not considered in performance reviews. No recognition for security practices.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic reporting channels exist for security concerns. Some security objectives are included in performance reviews. Occasional recognition for good security practices.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Multiple channels for reporting security concerns are actively promoted. Security objectives are a key part of all performance reviews. Regular recognition and rewards for exemplary security practices are implemented.

criteria.title: Leadership Commitment
criteria.description: Executive sponsorship of security initiatives. Allocation of adequate resources for security programs. Regular communication from leadership on security importance.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited leadership involvement in security initiatives. Minimal resources allocated to security. Infrequent or no communication from leadership about security.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some executive sponsorship of key security initiatives. Moderate resource allocation for security programs. Occasional leadership communication on security importance.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Strong executive sponsorship of all security initiatives. Ample resources allocated to comprehensive security programs. Frequent and clear communication from leadership emphasizing the critical importance of security.

criteria.title: Continuous Education
criteria.description: Access to ongoing security education and resources. Promotion of best practices in daily operations. Inclusion of security topics in company meetings and communications.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or ad-hoc security education. Best practices are not consistently promoted. Security topics rarely discussed in company communications.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some ongoing security education available. Best practices promoted in certain areas. Security topics occasionally included in company meetings and communications.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, role-specific security education programs readily available. Best practices actively promoted and integrated into daily operations. Security topics regularly featured in company meetings and communications.

criteria.title: Phishing and Social Engineering Resilience
criteria.description: Regular phishing simulation tests. Training on recognizing and reporting social engineering attempts. Metrics on employee performance in simulations and targeted improvements.

maturity_definitions.novice: No phishing simulations conducted. Limited or no training on social engineering. No metrics tracked on employee performance.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Occasional phishing simulations. Basic training on recognizing social engineering attempts. Some metrics tracked, but limited use for improvement.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Regular, sophisticated phishing simulations. Comprehensive training on various social engineering techniques. Detailed metrics tracked and used for targeted improvements and personalized training.

criteria.title: Cloud Security
criteria.description: Measures to secure cloud-based infrastructure, platforms, and services utilized by the organization.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited understanding of cloud security risks. Few specific cloud security measures implemented. Reactive approach to cloud security incidents.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic cloud security measures in place. Some understanding of cloud-specific risks. Proactive measures implemented for major known risks.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive cloud security strategy implemented. Deep understanding of cloud-specific risks and shared responsibility model. Proactive and adaptive approach to cloud security with continuous monitoring and improvement.

criteria.title: Cloud Governance
criteria.description: Defined policies for cloud usage and management. Alignment of cloud security practices with overall security policies. Understanding of the shared responsibility model in cloud environments.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal cloud governance policies. Limited alignment with overall security policies. Poor understanding of shared responsibility model.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic cloud governance policies in place. Partial alignment with overall security policies. General understanding of shared responsibility model.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive cloud governance framework implemented. Full alignment of cloud security practices with overall security policies. Clear understanding and implementation of shared responsibility model across the organization.

criteria.title: Cloud Configuration Management
criteria.description: Regular audits of cloud configurations to identify and remediate misconfigurations. Use of automated tools to enforce secure configurations (e.g., Infrastructure as Code scanning).

maturity_definitions.novice: Infrequent or no audits of cloud configurations. Manual configuration processes. No use of automated tools for configuration management.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Periodic audits of cloud configurations. Some use of automated tools for configuration management. Basic remediation processes in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Continuous auditing and monitoring of cloud configurations. Extensive use of automated tools and Infrastructure as Code for secure configuration management. Rapid remediation processes with change management integration.

criteria.title: Data Security in the Cloud
criteria.description: Encryption of data at rest and in transit within cloud services. Secure key management practices specific to cloud services. Implementation of data loss prevention (DLP) controls in the cloud.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or inconsistent encryption practices. Basic key management. No specific cloud DLP controls.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Encryption for most sensitive data at rest and in transit. Established key management practices. Basic DLP controls implemented in cloud environments.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive encryption for all data at rest and in transit. Advanced, cloud-specific key management practices. Sophisticated DLP controls fully integrated with cloud services and on-premises systems.

criteria.title: Access Management
criteria.description: Implementation of identity and access management controls for cloud resources. Use of multi-factor authentication for cloud administration. Regular review of cloud access permissions and roles.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic identity management for cloud resources. Limited use of multi-factor authentication. Infrequent review of access permissions.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Identity and access management controls implemented for most cloud resources. Multi-factor authentication for critical systems. Periodic review of access permissions and roles.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive identity and access management across all cloud resources. Mandatory multi-factor authentication for all cloud access. Continuous monitoring and automated review of access permissions and roles.

criteria.title: Vendor Security Practices
criteria.description: Assessment of cloud service providers' security posture and certifications. Continuous monitoring of cloud vendor compliance and performance. Exit strategies and data retrieval plans from cloud providers.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited assessment of cloud providers' security. No continuous monitoring of vendor compliance. No formal exit strategies.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic assessment of major cloud providers' security posture. Periodic monitoring of vendor compliance. General exit strategies in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Thorough assessment and continuous monitoring of all cloud providers' security posture and certifications. Comprehensive exit strategies and data retrieval plans regularly tested and updated.

criteria.title: Security Architecture and Design
criteria.description: The integration of security principles into the architecture and design of systems and applications to build a robust and resilient environment.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security considerations are an afterthought in architecture and design. No formal security architecture principles applied.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security principles incorporated into architecture and design. Some standardization of security design practices.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Security is a fundamental component of all architecture and design decisions. Comprehensive security architecture framework consistently applied across the organization.

criteria.title: Security by Design
criteria.description: Incorporation of security considerations from the initial design phase. Use of threat modeling and architectural risk analysis during design. Adoption of secure design patterns and principles.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security considerations often overlooked in initial design. No formal threat modeling or risk analysis. Limited awareness of secure design patterns.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security considerations included in design phase. Some use of threat modeling and risk analysis. Adoption of common secure design patterns.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Security fully integrated into all stages of design. Comprehensive threat modeling and risk analysis for all projects. Consistent use of advanced secure design patterns and principles.

criteria.title: Secure Architecture Principles
criteria.description: Documentation of security architecture and design decisions. Alignment with industry frameworks and standards (e.g., SABSA, NIST). Regular reviews and updates of security architecture in response to changes.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited documentation of security architecture decisions. Minimal alignment with industry standards. Infrequent reviews of security architecture.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic documentation of major security architecture decisions. Partial alignment with key industry frameworks. Periodic reviews of security architecture.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive documentation of all security architecture and design decisions. Full alignment with relevant industry frameworks and standards. Regular reviews and proactive updates of security architecture.

criteria.title: Segregation and Isolation
criteria.description: Implementation of network and system segmentation to limit access. Use of virtualization and containerization with appropriate security controls. Isolation of critical systems and sensitive data environments.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal network segmentation. Limited use of virtualization or containerization. No specific isolation for critical systems.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic network segmentation implemented. Some use of virtualization and containerization with security controls. Partial isolation of critical systems.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive network and system segmentation. Extensive use of secure virtualization and containerization. Complete isolation of all critical systems and sensitive data environments with continuous monitoring.

criteria.title: Resilience and Redundancy
criteria.description: Design for high availability and fault tolerance. Implementation of redundancy for critical components. Consideration of security impacts in disaster recovery architectures.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited consideration of resilience in design. Minimal redundancy for critical components. Basic disaster recovery plans with limited security considerations.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Moderate level of resilience and redundancy in design. Redundancy implemented for most critical components. Disaster recovery plans include some security considerations.
maturity_definitions.advanced: High availability and fault tolerance built into all designs. Full redundancy for all critical components with automatic failover. Comprehensive disaster recovery architectures with security fully integrated at all levels.

criteria.title: Secure DevOps (DevSecOps)
criteria.description: Integration of security practices into the DevOps processes to ensure security is a shared responsibility throughout the development and operations lifecycle.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security is treated as a separate concern from development and operations. There are minimal or ad-hoc security practices in the development lifecycle.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some security practices are integrated into the DevOps process, but implementation is inconsistent. There's growing awareness of shared security responsibility.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Security is fully integrated into DevOps processes. There's a culture of shared responsibility for security across development, operations, and security teams. Continuous security practices are embedded throughout the lifecycle.

criteria.title: Automated Security Testing
criteria.description: Integration of security testing tools into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., SAST, DAST, dependency checking). Automated enforcement of security policies during builds and deployments. Regular scanning for secrets and credentials in code repositories.

maturity_definitions.novice: Manual security testing is performed sporadically. There's little to no automation in security testing processes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some automated security testing tools are integrated into CI/CD pipelines, but coverage is incomplete. Basic policy enforcement exists during builds.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive automated security testing is integrated into CI/CD pipelines, including SAST, DAST, and dependency checking. Automated policy enforcement and regular secret scanning are standard practices.

criteria.title: Security Collaboration
criteria.description: Cross-functional teams including security professionals. Shared responsibility for security across development, operations, and security teams. Regular security training and awareness for DevOps personnel.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security team works in isolation. Limited interaction between development, operations, and security teams.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some collaboration between teams exists. Occasional joint projects or meetings occur, but roles remain largely siloed.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Fully integrated cross-functional teams with embedded security professionals. Regular security training for all DevOps personnel. Culture of shared security responsibility is well-established.

criteria.title: Infrastructure as Code Security
criteria.description: Security reviews of infrastructure code (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation templates). Use of tools to detect insecure configurations in IaC templates. Implementation of policies to prevent insecure code from being deployed.

maturity_definitions.novice: Infrastructure code is not reviewed for security. No tools are used to detect insecure configurations in IaC.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some manual security reviews of infrastructure code occur. Basic tools are used to detect obvious misconfigurations.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive security reviews of all infrastructure code. Advanced tools automatically detect and prevent insecure configurations. Strict policies prevent deployment of insecure infrastructure code.

criteria.title: Continuous Compliance
criteria.description: Real-time compliance checks integrated into development workflows. Automated compliance reporting and remediation suggestions. Alignment of DevSecOps practices with regulatory requirements.

maturity_definitions.novice: Compliance is checked manually and infrequently. No integration of compliance checks into development workflows.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some automated compliance checks exist, but they're not real-time. Basic compliance reporting is in place, but remediation is largely manual.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Real-time compliance checks are fully integrated into development workflows. Automated compliance reporting and remediation suggestions are standard. DevSecOps practices are fully aligned with regulatory requirements.

criteria.title: Mobile and Endpoint Security
criteria.description: Security measures specific to mobile applications and endpoint devices used within the organization.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or ad-hoc security measures for mobile apps and endpoints. No formal policies or management in place.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security measures implemented for mobile apps and endpoints. Some policies exist but may not be consistently enforced.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive security measures for all mobile apps and endpoints. Robust policies and management practices are consistently enforced across the organization.

criteria.title: Secure Mobile Development
criteria.description: Implementation of secure coding practices for mobile apps. Regular security testing of mobile applications (e.g., code reviews, penetration testing). Protection against common mobile threats (e.g., OWASP Mobile Top 10).

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited awareness of secure mobile development practices. Minimal security testing of mobile apps.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic secure coding practices are followed. Occasional security testing of mobile apps is conducted.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive secure coding practices are consistently applied. Regular, thorough security testing of all mobile apps. Robust protection against OWASP Mobile Top 10 and other common mobile threats.

criteria.title: Mobile Device Management (MDM)
criteria.description: Policies for managing and securing mobile devices used within the organization. Use of MDM solutions to enforce security controls (e.g., device encryption, remote wipe). Support for Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) policies with appropriate security measures.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal MDM policies or solutions in place. BYOD is unmanaged or discouraged.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic MDM policies exist and some MDM solutions are in use. Limited BYOD support with basic security measures.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive MDM policies and solutions are fully implemented. Robust BYOD support with strong security measures. Advanced features like device encryption and remote wipe are standard.

criteria.title: Endpoint Security
criteria.description: Deployment of endpoint protection platforms (EPP) and endpoint detection and response (EDR) tools. Regular updates and patch management for endpoint devices. Policies for securing remote and off-network endpoints.

maturity_definitions.novice: Basic antivirus software is used. Updates and patches are applied inconsistently. Limited policies for remote endpoints.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: EPP solutions are deployed on most endpoints. Regular update and patch management processes exist. Basic policies for remote endpoints are in place.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Advanced EPP and EDR tools are deployed on all endpoints. Automated, regular updates and patch management. Comprehensive policies for securing all endpoints, including remote and off-network devices.

criteria.title: Application Distribution Security
criteria.description: Secure processes for distributing mobile apps (e.g., enterprise app stores, official app stores). Protection against tampering and unauthorized distribution. Code signing and validation of application integrity.

maturity_definitions.novice: No controlled app distribution process. Apps are distributed ad-hoc with minimal security checks.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic app distribution processes in place. Some measures to prevent tampering and unauthorized distribution.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Secure, controlled app distribution processes fully implemented. Robust protection against tampering and unauthorized distribution. Consistent use of code signing and integrity validation for all distributed apps.

criteria.title: Data Backup and Recovery
criteria.description: Strategies and processes to ensure that data can be recovered in the event of loss, corruption, or disaster.

maturity_definitions.novice: Backups are performed irregularly. No formal recovery processes in place. Limited testing of backups.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular backups are performed for critical data. Basic recovery processes exist. Occasional testing of backups and recovery procedures.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, regular backups of all critical data and systems. Well-documented, tested recovery processes. Regular, thorough testing of backups and recovery procedures.

criteria.title: Backup Policies and Procedures
criteria.description: Regular backups of critical data and systems. Offsite and offline storage of backups to prevent ransomware impact. Defined backup schedules and retention policies.

maturity_definitions.novice: Inconsistent backup practices. No formal policies or procedures. Backups are stored onsite only.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Regular backups of most critical data. Basic offsite storage implemented. Some defined backup schedules and retention policies exist.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, regular backups of all critical data and systems. Robust offsite and offline storage practices. Well-defined, consistently followed backup schedules and retention policies.

criteria.title: Backup Security
criteria.description: Encryption of backup data at rest and in transit. Access controls and authentication for backup systems. Regular testing of backup integrity and restorability.

maturity_definitions.novice: Minimal security measures for backups. No encryption of backup data. Limited access controls.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic encryption of some backup data. Some access controls and authentication measures in place. Occasional testing of backup integrity.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Full encryption of all backup data at rest and in transit. Robust access controls and authentication for all backup systems. Regular, comprehensive testing of backup integrity and restorability.

criteria.title: Recovery Procedures
criteria.description: Documented data recovery procedures. Regular testing of data restoration processes. Defined Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO) for data.

maturity_definitions.novice: No documented recovery procedures. Recovery is ad-hoc. No defined RTO or RPO.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic documented recovery procedures exist. Occasional testing of data restoration. RTO and RPO defined for some critical systems.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, well-documented recovery procedures. Regular testing of all data restoration processes. Clearly defined and regularly reviewed RTO and RPO for all systems.

criteria.title: Resilience Against Data Loss
criteria.description: Use of immutable backups or write-once-read-many (WORM) storage. Protection against insider threats and unauthorized backup deletions. Monitoring and alerts for backup failures or anomalies.

maturity_definitions.novice: No special measures for backup resilience. Vulnerable to insider threats and unauthorized deletions. No monitoring of backup processes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some use of immutable backups or WORM storage. Basic protection against insider threats. Limited monitoring of backup processes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Widespread use of immutable backups or WORM storage. Robust protection against insider threats and unauthorized deletions. Comprehensive monitoring and alerting for all backup processes and anomalies.

criteria.title: Security Metrics and Reporting
criteria.description: Use of metrics to measure, monitor, and report on the effectiveness of security controls and processes, enabling informed decision-making.

maturity_definitions.novice: Few or no security metrics collected. Reporting is ad-hoc or non-existent.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security metrics are collected and reported periodically. Some use of metrics in decision-making.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive set of security metrics regularly collected, analyzed, and reported. Metrics are integral to security decision-making and strategy.

criteria.title: Defined Security KPIs
criteria.description: Establishment of key performance indicators for security (e.g., incident response times, vulnerability remediation rates). Alignment of KPIs with organizational security objectives.

maturity_definitions.novice: Few or no security KPIs defined. Metrics are ad hoc and not consistently tracked or aligned with organizational objectives.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic set of security KPIs established and regularly tracked. Some alignment with organizational objectives, but may lack comprehensiveness or strategic focus.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive set of security KPIs fully aligned with organizational objectives. KPIs are regularly reviewed, updated, and used to drive strategic security decisions.

criteria.title: Reporting and Dashboards
criteria.description: Use of dashboards to provide real-time visibility into security posture. Regular reporting to stakeholders on security status, trends, and risks. Customizable reports for different audiences (e.g., technical teams, executive leadership).

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited or ad hoc security reporting. No standardized dashboards or audience-specific reports.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security dashboards implemented. Regular reports provided, but may lack customization for different audiences or real-time capabilities.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, real-time security dashboards with drill-down capabilities. Customized reports for various stakeholders, providing actionable insights and trend analysis.

criteria.title: Continuous Improvement
criteria.description: Use of metrics to identify areas for improvement. Implementation of improvement plans based on metric analysis. Regular review and adjustment of KPIs to reflect changing priorities.

maturity_definitions.novice: Little to no use of metrics for improvement. Security processes remain static and reactive.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some use of metrics to guide improvements. Occasional review and adjustment of KPIs, but may lack consistency or strategic alignment.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Metrics consistently drive improvement initiatives. Regular, structured reviews of KPIs with proactive adjustments to align with evolving security landscape and organizational priorities.

criteria.title: Benchmarking
criteria.description: Comparison of security metrics against industry benchmarks. Participation in security surveys and sharing of anonymized data for benchmarking purposes. Use of benchmarks to set realistic and challenging security goals.

maturity_definitions.novice: No or minimal benchmarking activities. Security goals set without industry context.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some comparison against industry benchmarks. Occasional participation in security surveys, but limited use of results for goal-setting.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Regular participation in industry benchmarking activities. Proactive sharing of anonymized data. Benchmarks consistently inform challenging yet realistic security goals.

criteria.title: Privacy by Design and Default
criteria.description: Integration of privacy considerations into the design and operation of systems and processes, ensuring that privacy is a core component of the organization's activities.

maturity_definitions.novice: Privacy considerations are often an afterthought in system design and processes. Limited understanding of privacy by design principles.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic privacy considerations integrated into some systems and processes. Inconsistent application of privacy by design principles across the organization.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Privacy by design principles fully integrated into all systems, processes, and organizational culture. Proactive approach to privacy protection in all activities.

criteria.title: Privacy Integration in Development
criteria.description: Inclusion of privacy impact assessments in project initiation. Design of systems to collect and process the minimum necessary personal data. Implementation of user consent mechanisms and preferences management.

maturity_definitions.novice: Privacy impact assessments rarely conducted. Limited consideration of data minimization or user consent in system design.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Privacy impact assessments conducted for major projects. Basic data minimization and user consent mechanisms implemented, but may lack consistency.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Privacy impact assessments integrated into all project initiations. Robust data minimization practices and user consent mechanisms consistently implemented across all systems.

criteria.title: Default Privacy Settings
criteria.description: Systems configured with the highest privacy settings by default. Clear and accessible privacy notices and policies. Easy-to-use tools for users to manage their privacy settings.

maturity_definitions.novice: Default settings often prioritize functionality over privacy. Privacy notices may be unclear or difficult to access.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some systems configured with privacy-friendly defaults. Privacy notices are available but may lack clarity or accessibility for all users.
maturity_definitions.advanced: All systems configured with highest privacy settings by default. Clear, concise privacy notices easily accessible. Intuitive tools for users to manage privacy preferences.

criteria.title: Data Minimization and Anonymization
criteria.description: Strategies for reducing the amount of personal data collected and stored. Use of anonymization and pseudonymization techniques where appropriate. Regular reviews to identify and eliminate unnecessary data collection.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited strategies for data minimization. Anonymization techniques rarely used. Infrequent reviews of data collection practices.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic data minimization strategies in place. Some use of anonymization techniques. Occasional reviews to reduce unnecessary data collection.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive data minimization strategies implemented. Advanced anonymization and pseudonymization techniques used consistently. Regular, systematic reviews to optimize data collection and storage.

criteria.title: Compliance with Privacy Regulations
criteria.description: Adherence to privacy laws and regulations beyond data protection (e.g., ePrivacy Directive). Regular updates to privacy practices based on regulatory changes. Engagement with legal experts to ensure ongoing compliance.

maturity_definitions.novice: Reactive approach to privacy compliance. Limited understanding of applicable regulations beyond basic data protection laws.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Compliance with major privacy regulations. Some proactive updates to privacy practices, but may lack comprehensive coverage of all applicable laws.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Proactive compliance with all relevant privacy regulations. Regular engagement with legal experts. Privacy practices continuously updated to stay ahead of regulatory changes.

criteria.title: Security Awareness Beyond Training
criteria.description: Cultivating a security-conscious culture that extends beyond formal training programs, embedding security into the organization's ethos.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security awareness limited to basic, mandatory training sessions. Limited efforts to cultivate a security-conscious culture.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Security awareness extends beyond formal training, with some additional initiatives. Beginnings of a security-conscious culture, but not fully embedded.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive approach to security awareness deeply embedded in organizational culture. Security consciousness evident in daily operations and decision-making at all levels.

criteria.title: Security Champions Program
criteria.description: Identification and empowerment of security advocates within different teams. Regular meetings and knowledge-sharing sessions among security champions. Incentives and recognition for contributions to organizational security.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal security champions program. Limited identification or empowerment of security advocates within teams.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic security champions program established. Some regular meetings and knowledge-sharing, but may lack structured incentives or recognition.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Robust security champions program with advocates in all key teams. Regular, structured knowledge-sharing sessions. Clear incentives and recognition for security contributions.

criteria.title: Gamification and Engagement
criteria.description: Use of gamification techniques to encourage secure behaviors (e.g., security quizzes, competitions). Reward systems for reporting security issues or demonstrating good practices. Interactive and engaging security awareness campaigns.

maturity_definitions.novice: Little to no use of gamification or interactive techniques in security awareness. Engagement with security topics is low.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some use of gamification and interactive techniques. Basic reward systems in place, but may lack consistency or widespread adoption.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive use of gamification and interactive techniques. Well-structured reward systems driving high engagement. Creative, regularly refreshed security awareness campaigns.

criteria.title: Integration into Daily Operations
criteria.description: Inclusion of security considerations in project meetings and discussions. Encouragement of open dialogue about security concerns and ideas. Alignment of security goals with overall business objectives.

maturity_definitions.novice: Security rarely discussed outside of dedicated security meetings. Limited alignment of security with business objectives.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Security considerations included in some project meetings. Some encouragement of open dialogue about security, but not consistently across all areas.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Security fully integrated into all relevant meetings and discussions. Open dialogue about security actively encouraged. Security goals clearly aligned and integrated with business objectives.

criteria.title: Leadership Modeling
criteria.description: Visible commitment to security by leadership through actions and communications. Inclusion of security topics in leadership presentations and town halls. Accountability of leaders for security outcomes within their areas.

maturity_definitions.novice: Limited visible commitment to security from leadership. Security topics rarely addressed in leadership communications.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some visible commitment to security from leadership. Occasional inclusion of security topics in leadership communications. Inconsistent accountability for security outcomes.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Strong, consistent commitment to security visibly demonstrated by leadership. Regular inclusion of security topics in communications. Clear accountability for security outcomes at leadership level.

criteria.title: Organizational Structure and Roles
criteria.description: The clarity, efficiency, and suitability of the organization's structure and defined roles in supporting its objectives.

maturity_definitions.novice: Organizational structure is unclear or undocumented. Roles are poorly defined, leading to confusion and inefficiency in achieving objectives.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic organizational structure exists with some role definitions. However, there are gaps in clarity and efficiency that hinder full support of objectives.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Well-documented, efficient organizational structure with clearly defined roles. Structure and roles are regularly reviewed and optimized to fully support organizational objectives.

criteria.title: Clear Role Definitions
criteria.description: Well-documented job descriptions for all positions. Clear understanding of responsibilities among team members.

maturity_definitions.novice: Job descriptions are missing or outdated. Team members are often confused about their responsibilities and those of others.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Most positions have job descriptions, but they may lack detail or consistency. Some team members understand their responsibilities, while others remain uncertain.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, up-to-date job descriptions exist for all positions. All team members have a clear understanding of their own and others' responsibilities.

criteria.title: Efficient Team Structure
criteria.description: Organizational hierarchy that supports effective communication and decision-making. Appropriate ratio of managers to individual contributors.

maturity_definitions.novice: Hierarchy is unclear or ineffective. Communication channels are broken. Manager-to-contributor ratio is imbalanced, leading to inefficiencies.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic hierarchy exists with some support for communication and decision-making. Manager-to-contributor ratio is improving but still not optimal.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Well-designed hierarchy facilitates smooth communication and swift decision-making. Optimal manager-to-contributor ratio ensures efficiency across the organization.

criteria.title: Role Alignment with Business Goals
criteria.description: Roles and responsibilities aligned with strategic objectives. Regular reviews to adjust roles as the company evolves.

maturity_definitions.novice: Roles are not aligned with business goals. No process exists for reviewing or adjusting roles as the company changes.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some roles are aligned with business goals. Occasional reviews occur, but adjustments are inconsistent or reactive.
maturity_definitions.advanced: All roles are clearly aligned with strategic objectives. Regular, proactive reviews ensure roles evolve in tandem with company growth and changing needs.

criteria.title: Team Composition
criteria.description: Balanced mix of experience levels (junior, mid-level, senior). Presence of necessary specialized roles (e.g., DevOps, security specialists, UX designers).

maturity_definitions.novice: Team is imbalanced, lacking diversity in experience levels. Specialized roles are missing or understaffed.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some balance in experience levels exists. A few specialized roles are present, but gaps remain in critical areas.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Well-balanced team with optimal mix of junior, mid-level, and senior members. All necessary specialized roles are filled with skilled professionals.

criteria.title: Cross-Functional Capabilities
criteria.description: Teams capable of handling end-to-end delivery of features or products. Presence of T-shaped skills within team members.

maturity_definitions.novice: Teams are siloed with limited cross-functional capabilities. T-shaped skills are rare or non-existent.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Some teams show cross-functional capabilities. A few team members possess T-shaped skills, but not consistently across the organization.
maturity_definitions.advanced: All teams demonstrate strong cross-functional capabilities, consistently delivering end-to-end features. T-shaped skills are prevalent and actively cultivated.

criteria.title: Recruitment, Onboarding, and Retention
criteria.description: The effectiveness of the organization's processes for attracting, hiring, integrating, and retaining talent.

maturity_definitions.novice: Recruitment is ad-hoc, onboarding is minimal, and retention strategies are non-existent. High turnover rates are common.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic recruitment and onboarding processes exist. Some retention strategies are in place, but turnover remains a challenge.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Sophisticated, data-driven recruitment processes. Comprehensive onboarding programs. Effective retention strategies result in high employee satisfaction and low turnover.

criteria.title: Strategic Recruitment Practices
criteria.description: Well-defined hiring processes aligned with organizational needs and culture. Use of diverse sourcing channels and techniques.

maturity_definitions.novice: Hiring processes are undefined or inconsistent. Limited use of sourcing channels, mostly relying on job boards.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic hiring processes exist but may not fully align with organizational needs. Some diversity in sourcing channels, but room for expansion.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, well-defined hiring processes tightly aligned with organizational needs and culture. Wide range of sourcing channels and innovative recruitment techniques utilized.

criteria.title: Technical Assessment
criteria.description: Robust evaluation of both hard and soft skills during hiring. Use of technical assessments (e.g., coding tests, system design interviews).

maturity_definitions.novice: Technical assessments are basic or inconsistent. Little consideration given to soft skills evaluation.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Standard technical assessments are in place. Some attention is given to soft skills, but evaluation methods may lack depth or consistency.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive technical assessments tailored to each role. Structured evaluation of both hard and soft skills using diverse, role-specific methods.

criteria.title: Structured Onboarding Program
criteria.description: Comprehensive training for new hires. Clear documentation and resources for new team members.

maturity_definitions.novice: Onboarding is informal and inconsistent. Limited or outdated documentation available for new hires.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic onboarding program exists with some standardized elements. Some documentation and resources are available, but may have gaps.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Comprehensive, well-structured onboarding program tailored to different roles. Extensive, up-to-date documentation and resources readily accessible to all new team members.

criteria.title: Time to Productivity
criteria.description: Metrics tracking how quickly new hires become fully productive. Regular review and optimization of the onboarding process.

maturity_definitions.novice: No formal tracking of new hire productivity. Onboarding process is not reviewed or optimized.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Basic metrics in place to track new hire productivity. Occasional reviews of the onboarding process, but optimization is inconsistent.
maturity_definitions.advanced: Sophisticated metrics and analytics used to track and improve time to productivity. Regular, data-driven reviews lead to continuous optimization of the onboarding process.

criteria.title: Employee Retention Strategies
criteria.description: Competitive compensation and benefits. Programs promoting employee engagement and satisfaction. Low turnover rates compared to industry averages.

maturity_definitions.novice: Compensation and benefits are below market standards. Few or no programs for employee engagement. High turnover rates.
maturity_definitions.intermediate: Compensation and benefits are at market level. Some engagement programs exist. Turnover rates are around industry average.
